The people of Almada love and worship him as a saint, but in the rest of the kingdom the pale young man is ridiculed, as he is surrounded since his early childhood by secrets and dark prophecies. But the Moon Emperor, as his followers call him, is not willing to wait for his fate: He calls for the dignity he deserves - and he seems willing to enter into a war.
While the heroes are abroad in the realm of the Moon Emperor, they discover a secret hidden behind veils and dreams. And they get an idea of the tremendous powers lurking in the background, while the situation is escalating and crashes the Middle Empire into a new civil war.

85104.name: Buck Rogers: Planet of Zoom
85104.description:
From the back of the package:

It's the 25th century. You are Buck Rogers fighting the battle of planet Zoom. Skillfully slip through zapping electron posts. Dodge and destroy deadly space hoppers and alien saucers. Your race against death has just begun. Prepare for battle with your most powerful enemy... The mother ship! It's never easy when it's do or die. You must hit the mother ship with two deadly shots. Anything less will just waste precious time. Aim steady, but hurry... Your time is dangerously low.

> One player cosmic combat
> Explosive 3-D color graphics
> Four galactic screens per round
> Presicion pilot skills and challenges

85105.description:
Some people love to travel. Others love to read about traveling. Imagine an Internet magazine designed to bring these people together. Would you like to join ranks of their travelbloggers?
Travel Blog is a swift and thrilling game about travelling. Your task is to pick a country or countries most suitable for your trip and to do it faster than your opponents. How many borders do you cross on your trip from France to Russia? Is it more or less than from Norway to Turkey? Detailed knowledge of the map is an advantage, but can be easily beaten by good intuition and fast decision making.
The interesting facts about 100 countries and states are here just as a bonus. This is not a trivia game – Travel Blog keeps to be fun even if you get pretty familiar with the maps. And you can bet you will, after a few games.

(from CGE web site)
85105.name: Travel Blog

85106.name: Angmark
85106.description:
Publisher Blurb:
The western most of the Marklands, Angmark is a realm of growing prosperity. But with that new found wealth comes danger, for orcs are growing in strength on the northern border, seeing in Angmark a rich target for raiding. Isolated from their Saxa brethren, the inhabitants of Angmark have grown more independent with each generation. This supplement expands on material in the Hellfrost Gazetteer.

85107.name: 3 Or More
85107.description:
"A game of strategy for two to four players. Compete to make rows of three or more of the same colour." - box lid.
The game contains 4 racks, one for each player, and 44 oblong cards which each have a line of three spots in combinations of red, yellow, green and blue. Each player takes 3 cards from the face down cards. The first player lays a tile replacing it from the remainder. The next player lays a card alongside one of the long edges of the first card. Further cards are similarly laid alongside either long side of the previously laid cards until completion of 11 cards. Then a second row of cards is laid adjacent to one of four short edges of the end cards starting a parallel row of cards. The game ends when 4 rows of cards are complete. Scoring is by each player announcing how many new rows of 3 or more same coloured dots have been formed by the card laid, horizontal, vertical and diagonal, counting 3 for a row of 3 dots, 4 for a row of 4 dots etc. Diagonal rows count double. When all cards are played the player with the highest score is the winner.

85108.description:
"The only thing that ever frightened me during the war was the U-Boat peril." - Winston Churchill

The Battle of the Atlantic was the longest continuous campaign of World War II running from 1939 through to the defeat of Germany in 1945. It involved thousands of ships, stretched over hundreds of miles of ocean, and involved hundreds of convoy battles and single-ship encounters. During the struggle advantage switched back and forth between the U-boats and Allies as new weapons, tactics, and countermeasures were developed and implemented.

U-Boat Leader takes the Leader series to new depths, letting players control a group of U-boats on missions in the Atlantic. The core system of the game will be familiar to players of other Leader games, allowing them to quickly get into the game.

A major portion of the game is determining where to send your submarines. Do you concentrate your submarines in one or two areas to form wolfpacks or spread them out in the shipping lanes to increase the chances of finding contacts, or do you send them on special missions (such as mine-laying)? You can also spend Special Operations Points to support your submarines by adding search planes to help find enemy ships or by sending supply ships and subs (Milk Cows) to extend the endurance of the submarines. During longer campaigns you need to manage the U-boat patrol rotation to keep subs on station.

When a patrolling U-boat comes into contact with an enemy force it can call other boats in the same patrol zone to form a wolfpack or attack alone. The action then shifts to the tactical display where the U-boats try to close with and attack merchants while avoiding the escorting warships. When an attack starts you will have an idea of the number and general type of ships in the group, but you have to close with the ships to actually identify the ships.

U-Boat Leader includes the following type of U-boats:
Type IIB/C coastal submarines
Type VII A/B/C Atlantic submarines
Type IX A/B/C long-range submarines
Type XXI Elektro-boat

U-Boat Leader includes four campaigns covering different stages of the Battle of the Atlantic:

The Battle Begins: covering operations at the start of World War II to about mid-1940.

The Happy Time: covering the period from mid-1940 to mid-1941 when the U-boats and wolfpacks dominated the seas.

Operation Drumbeat: covering operations off the American coast and in the Caribbean in early 1942.

The Hunted: covering the time period when the tide starts to turn against the U-boats.

-Dan Verssen Games

Other Leader series games by Dan Verssen
85108.name: U-Boat Leader

boardgameaccessory.204654: U-Boat Leader and GATO Leader: Ship Miniatures & Battle Board!

85109.name: Games International (Issue 5 – May 1989)
85109.description:
Issue 5 of Games International


Contents

Cover – First Past the Post

Up Front – Editorial
Review Section

General Games Reviews;

First Past the Post
Circus Imperium
Deal Me In
Pole Position




Britannia – the ABC guide to major invasion (see Web Links below)
R.I.P. – into the fast lane with Niki Lauder's Formel Eins
Strategy Seminar – opening moves in Die Macher (see Web Links below)
Owzat! – Wicketz creator Alf Compton interviewed
Palace of Varieties – variants for popular games
Viva Las Vegas – Total Confusion and GAMA fair photo report
The Twilight Zone – sports games fanzines
Consumer Guide – quick summary for eager punters
Desert Island Games – with castaway Philip Murphy
Sniper – Gaming gossip from around the world
News

Wargame Reviews;

Sniper! Bughunter
Peninsular War
The Last Hurrah
Red Storm Rising




Role-Playing games Reviews;

AD&D 2nd Edition
Sword & Glory Sourcebook
Tales of the Ether
Calandia Guidebook




Cyberpunk Special Feature - with reviews on Cyberpunk and the Earth/Cybertech Sourcebook

Neochrome – how to run a cyberpunk game

Rebound – Letters page
Classifieds

85110.name: Sage
85110.description:
Sage is an abstract strategy game which plays like Hnefatafl.
It is played using a chinese chess board and pieces. The game starts with two equal armies of eleven pieces facing each other across the river - the Sage piece begins high in her tower, waiting to descend upon the battlefield.

Any piece may capture by sandwiching opposing pieces vertically or horizontally.

The aim is to score six points. These are achieved by moving your pieces into the river and off the board. The biggest tactical question is how soon you wish to move your pieces off the board - if you send too many off the board with an inadequate defence, your other pieces will be surrounded, but if you leave it too late, your opponent will slip off the board unchallenged.

The game is fantasy themed; with Immortal sages, swift apprentices and soaring skyships. It is set on Quiet Mountain, an experimental island of scientific sorcery that has pushed the bounds of its esoteric lore too far - tearing Reality apart in a catacalysmic disaster. The first Sage to leave Quiet Mountain will be able to reach the Empress and blame their counterpart for the disaster!

85111.name: Oathbound Eclipse
85111.description:
From the publisher's website:

Seven years now I have known myself, and though to many it may seem I have been idle and slack, I have in fact honed my craft and filled my head with the phenomena of the land I fashioned in my imprisonment, a land much apart from the rest of this Forge. Eclipse it is called… a land at the top of the world, the whole of which lies in an impossible crater, a break in the earth. Shunned by both suns, the land knows only shadow. Its inhabitants are those who do their work in the dark: thieves, cut throats, slavers, shapechangers, vampires... yet the dark has its lighter side as well, drawing artist, musician, and philosopher for its candle-light and clarity.

This is a domain of wild fungus forests, impossibly deep caverns, ink-black seas and shimmering cities. Here are long forgotten horrors that defy description, hiding in the darkest of dark places. Here are reckless pioneers, hoping to bring order to this realm that they might profit from the secrets and treasures hidden deep in the shell of the Forge.

Here in Eclipse I have walked, at times as a blind beggar, others as a thoughtful nobleman, and even rarely as my Seraphim self, gathering knowledge, personal accounts, illustrations, and even the odd recipe. I have drowned myself in politics and plant life, spoken to children, kings, warlords and have even risked conversations with the few here who might be capable of harm to one such as me. The wealth of knowledge I have gained could fill a hundred volumes, but in this short tome I will lay out for you what is best suited to allow you to make of the world what you want. All that I have complied here—from my disparate writings and humble illustrations, to the works of slaves, concubines and conquerors—is presented for your pleasure.

Features:
* A new approach to the sourcebook
* 5 new player character races
* 5 new player classes
* A new system for werran and vampire characters
* Expanded rules for vision
* New prestige races
* Full description of the domain of Eclipse.
* Monsters, spells, maps, magic, and more

85112.name: Dementium II
85112.description:
User Summary

Dementium II is a survival horror game developed by Renegade Kid for the Nintendo DS. It is the sequel to Dementium: The Ward, and takes place five weeks after the events of the first game. The player controls William Redmoor after he wakes up in the Bright Dawn Treatment centre shortly after having brain surgery. Once he is returned to his cell, the world shifts into an evil form allowing him to escape. This world-shifting mechanic is present throughout the game. Game mechanics are similar to Dementium II’s predecessor, but this game improves on mobility, allowing the player to jump and crouch as well as an updated map system that shows areas that have already been explored. Items can also be carried for later use. Dementium II can be completed in approximately 5 hours by a seasoned gamer, which makes it shorter than many other action adventure games.

85113.name: Ikari Warriors II: Victory Road
85113.description:
Victory Road (怒号層圏, Dogō Sōken (Bellowing Atmosphere)), is the sequel to Ikari Warriors.

The objective is to defeat the enemy aliens using grenades and other weapons.

Arcade version

The original arcade game featured an 8-way joystick that could be twisted in place to rotate the onscreen character allowing the player to face in one of eight directions while moving in another.

It features sampled voiceovers from the main characters and the game's bosses.

NES version

The NES version includes the added feature of collecting "zeny" as currency. This money was then spent at a store also unique to the NES port where the player could buy improved weaponry and armor. The NES version emulates the controls of the arcade version by locking the facing of the character in one direction for as long as the "fire" button was depressed.

Stages

The game continued its single-stage design from its prequel, but added mini-stages where player fights a boss when entered through the green door.

Source: Wikipedia, "Victory Road (arcade game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

85114.name: Dungeon Floor Modules
85114.description:
User summary:

A pad of 20 8.5 inch by 11 inch light cardstock color sheets use to layout dungeons for use with 25mm or 15 mm scale miniatures. Also included a double sided cover sheet.

85115.description:
Summarized from the rule sheet

Heroes and Villains from the Book of Mormon can be played by two or more people. Each player is given four cards from the shuffled deck, and the rest of the cards are placed face down to be the "fish pond".

The first player asks any other player for a card related to one of the cards s/he is holding. For instance, if player number one holds the "Nephi" card with "Obtain Brass Plates" at the top of the card, s/he will ask for any of the cards named on the bottom of the card, all of which are "Nephi" cards. If the player asked has that card, s/he must give it up and the first player gets to ask again, and plays until forced to "fish" (drawing a card from the draw pile when the first player requests a card from a player that isn't in the hand of that player).

All four cards equal a book, and the player with the most books at the end of the game wins.

Includes:
Rules
44 Cards
85115.name: Heroes & Villains from the Book of Mormon

85116.name: Ikari III: The Rescue
85116.description:
Ikari III: The Rescue aka Ikari Warriors III: The Rescue is an Arcade beat 'em up. It was ported to the NES, DOS, and C64. It is the second sequel to the original Ikari Warriors, following Victory Road.

Arcade Version

Unlike the previous two games, this game features hand-to-hand combat in addition to weapons, as well as more "life-like" character designs (as opposed to the "super deformed" versions of the characters in the first two games).

Gameplay

While the game still uses the rotary joystick, a version exists that forgoes the rotary feature altogether.

The weapon selection is greatly reduced from prequels, and there are no player usable vehicles. Weapons are much rarer, which makes the game more focused on hand to hand combat.

Stages

For the first time in the series, there are discrete stages.

Nintendo Entertainment System

This port maintains the characters design and basic game play over the arcade version, however the story and enemies are slightly altered.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ikari III: The Rescue", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

85118.name: Satanis Unbound
85118.description:
user summary

The first sourcebook for Empire of Satanis.

85119.name: Wheel of Fortune (1987)
85119.description:
User Summary

NES game emulating the Wheel of Fortune TV show. Players try to win money by solving word puzzles over three rounds, plus a bonus round.

85120.name: Double Spoiler
85120.description:
User Summary

Double Spoiler is a bullet hell game for the PC. The game is a sequel to Shoot the Bullet, and plays similarly, requiring the player to take photos of various bosses while avoiding being shot. Players cannot shoot at their enemies, but use their camera to clear the screen of bullets and score points. The value of the photo is dependent on the danger the player is exposed to while taking it and the aesthetics of the image. Each stage provides the player with only one life, and they must take a certain number of pictures within a set amount of time without being killed. Double Spoiler allows the player to change the photo orientation from portrait to landscape if they want, which was not available in Shoot the Bullet.

85121.name: True or Bluff
85121.description:
From the back of the box:

True or Bluff - The Game of Utter Codswallop

True or Bluff is a game of weird and wonderful word definitions!

This game challenges you to identify the correct definitions from amongst a set of false inventions... ...the truth from the codswallop!

Each word has been provided with three definitions and a fourth must be created off the cuff... You have to uncover the true answer whilst also revealing your opponent's crackpot creation!

Instant fun & laughter for those who love word play!


Contents:

Rules
4 True/Bluff flash cards
Score pad
Pencil
50 double sided True or Bluff cards

Gameplay:

The game is played by two teams, nominally of four aside but smaller or larger numbers can easily be accommodated. It is essentially a game version of the TV show Call My Bluff.

Each True or Bluff card contains an obscure word and four answers, a) to d), one of which is true and one of which is the phrase 'Your definition.' The cards are double sided with a different word and answer set on each side, giving 100 words in total.

Each team takes it in turn to read out the word on the card followed by the four answers, one of which they must make up on the spot (they have 2 minutes to do this although it usually takes much less time than that). The other team then has 2 guesses to try and work out which is the correct answer whilst trying to avoid the definition created by the other team. There are 10 rounds of this so each team has five turns bluffing and five turns guessing and at the end the team with the most points wins.

Scoring:

If the guessing team gets it right with their first guess they score two points. If they get it right on their second guess they only get one point.

If the guessing team gets it wrong with both guesses the bluffing team gets a bonus point. Additionally, if the guessing team picked the bluffing team's made up definition for either guess (even if they subsequently got it right) the bluffing team gets two more bonus points.

85122.name: Track & Field II
85122.description:
User Summary

Track and Field game simulating the 1988 Olympics in Korea. One or two players can compete in 12 events over the 5 day competition:
-Fencing
-Triple Jump
-Freestyle Swimming
-High Dive
-Clay Pigeon Shooting
-Hammer Throw
-Taekwondo
-Pole Vault
-Canoeing
-Archery
-Hurdles
-Horizontal Bar
-Arm Wrestling (Versus mode only)

85123.description:
From the publisher's website:

Joan of Arc's Victory covers the entire campaign of the siege and relief of Orleans, with one-month turns beginning in April, 1429. The French player must consolidate her polyglot army and its inspiring leader, while dealing with Joan's "voices" via an events table that leaves him feeling slightly out of control. The English player has to deal with Scots and herrings and trying to resist the "help" of an unwanted Burgundian ally. Both players face the challenges of making siege and open-field combat work for them, in an era where artillery and charges by armored knights belong on the same battlefield. The game includes 200 counters, a full-color, mounted mapboard, and all the charts you will need to keep your focus on the Maid.

Joan of Arc's Victory also includes a random "Joan Events" table that will render the French player a sense of the uncertainty being around someone divinely inspired might provide. And it keeps life interesting for the English too, as Joan may do something very unexpected (and have surprising combat benefits too!).

No two games will ever be alike.

Part of the TPS "Decisive Battles" series
That means straightforward rules, key insights into the history behind the game, and designs aimed at one-session conclusions and high replay value.
85123.name: Joan of Arc's Victory 1429 AD

85124.description:
From the publisher's website:

Each player will take the role of the operational theater commander. You still have leaders with short names and shorter tempers looking over your shoulder and telling you want to do (handled in game terms with directives and procedures that turn your decision making choices as much into "How do I please him?" as "How do I beat the enemy?") Counters represent mostly Soviet armies and German corps, with "assets" that can be attached to both, and minor Axis allies represented as well. Map scale is 55km to the hex, with 2 turns per month.

The Battle of Stalingrad manages to provide monster game nuances in a game small in size with innovative design. For example, the sequence of play is not the same for each side. And why should it be? The Axis and Soviet armies do not do the same tasks each turn, because their armies operated differently.

The Soviet player actually allocates supplies as he sees fit. Does he reward success or try to stave off defeat? Both players use Tactical and Strategic movement, as they move their forces around the battlefield. German Primary and Secondary objectives are determined randomly (and hidden from the Soviets!). Side operations in the Caucasus offer additional victory points but occupy units to achieve them. Are the points worth the cost?

Operation Uranus, the great Soviet counteroffensive, has optional start times, with incentives for delay (if the rest of the Soviet front can hold out!).

Sudden death victory is possible for both sides, encouraging that extra effort that could win it all...or leave one exposed and exhausted. At the end of the game, key point adjustments and multipliers get factored in and compared. Short of the Sudden Death victory, which side really "wins" can be in doubt to the very end.

As it should be, in a situation like this.

Part of the TPS, "Decisive Battles" series
That means straightforward rules, key insights into the history behind the game, and designs aimed at one-session conclusions and high replay value. With shifting objectives and variable entry times for key units, no two Stalingrad games will play the same.
85124.name: The Battle of Stalingrad

85125.name: Nightshade (NES)
85125.description:
"The game takes place in a fictional urban city called Metro City. As the story unfolds, the city's local superhero named Vortex is outnumbered by gangs and killed. With the city's protector murdered, the crime grows rapidly. Soon enough the city's crime lords start fighting over control of the city, until a villain named Sutekh takes control, combining all the gangs into one. With the city completely overrun by Sutekh and the other crime lords (Rat King, Goliath, Lord Muck, and Ninja Mistress), it is soon devoured in crime. A vigilante named Mark Gray (alias Nightshade) decides to step up and take the law into his own hands, vowing to rid Metro City of crime."

Source: Wikipedia, "Nightshade (NES)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

85126.name: Poltava's Dread Day: The Great Northern War 1700-1722 AD
85126.description:
From the publisher's website:

Poltava’s Dread Day covers a conflict that lasted nearly a quarter of a century (1700-1722), with two turns plus an administrative phase each year. The Summer turn is when everyone gets to work. The Winter turn is where great commanders take huge risks. All movement is a variable, impacted by leader initiative and a die roll. Sometimes, the troops will move far and fast. Sometimes they won't.

The game provides a range of different foot and horse unit types which impact how well they fight, but is unusual in one area—each unit is a single unit (strength of "1"), with no numbers to clutter up the counter. With few exceptions, once lost, units are gone forever...making each battle and each risk of attrition something to consider.

Poltava’s Dread Day provides a keen look into a decisive historical situation that few people know very much about. This period saw not only the founding of St. Petersburg but the birth of "modern" Russia. It saw the rise of Prussia, and led to shifts in the balance of power that would have significant effects on the Seven Years War.

Part of the TPS, "Decisive Battles" series
That means straightforward rules, key insights into the history behind the game, and designs aimed at one-session conclusions and high replay value. Poltava’s Dread Day features randomized elements for everything from reinforcements to diplomacy. No two games will play the same.

85127.name: Metal Storm
85127.description:
User Summary

A standard NES platformer with a unique feature - the player can reverse the direction of gravity at any time. This ability must be used to progress through unique puzzles in order to complete levels.

85128.name: Clonk Endeavor
85128.description:
From the game's website:

Clonk is a highly versatile multiplayer game of strategy, action, skill, and endless fun! Clonk Endeavour is the sequel to Clonk Planet and predecessor to the newer Clonk Rage in the series of 2D Clonk games.

Clonk Endeavour was the first Clonk game to use a 32 bit graphics system based on Direct3D and OpenGL for enhanced quality and lots of new visual effects.

The game was translated to nine different languages: German, English, French, Spanish, Italian, Russian, Finnish, Estonian, Hungarian. All language packs are included in the download.

85129.description:
From the Two Hour Wargames Site:
I, Zombie
The ATZ world is complete.

THE FOUR HORSEMEN HAVE ARRIVED

I, Zombie is the last book in the All Things Zombie Trilogy.
In the previous two books, ATZ and Haven, we gave you the "how" of the game. How do you get started? How do you shoot? How do vehicles work?
Everything you need to know about how to play the game is in those two books.

In I, Zombie, we focus on the 5 "W's" that will immerse you into the Zombie world. Now that you know the how it's time to take ATZ from a repetitive wargame to a full immersion game. We do this by giving you the 5 "W's". Who?
What?
Where?
When?
Why?




I, Zombie provides you with:

A completely populated area to game in centered around the Post-Apocalyptic town of Lake Havasu City, AZ.
Smart Zombies
Ragers
BA Worms ..."I tremor just thinking about them!"
Psionics
Rules for using interiors of buildings.
A complete economic system that allows you to grow your gang of survivors.
The best AI in tabletop gaming that allows you to play the game solo or cooperatively with everyone on the same side.




I, Zombie brings the story to life and it changes how you view All Things Zombie.

I, Zombie expands upon the ATZ:BDTZ rules by adding some new rule updates (ie, alternate rules for Fast Moves)and incorporating elements from other THW games, such as PEF (Possibel Enemy Forces) from Nuts!, and the rules for lack of sleep and using boats that were originally found in the ATZ scenario "Giving up the Goat." I, Zombie also introduces new rules for building your campaign and your characters in it. With the new rules you can make enemies that will carry their grudges against to the grave and make life miserable for you in future meetings.

With the new Building Interior rules, you can take the empty shells you were using as buildings and give them the rooms that they should have. Simply set up the interior tiles mark where the doors and windows are for each room, add your NPC's, Zombies, etc... and you are good to go.

I, Zombie is a supplement you will need the All Things Zombie: Better Dead Then Zed rules in order to play.
85129.name: All Things Zombie: I, Zombie

42101.name: All Things Zombie: Better Dead Than Zed!

85130.name: Aqua Around the World
85130.description:
Aqua Around the World is a trivia game based on the pop band Aqua. It is branded official Aqua merchandise.

From the back of the box (translated from Swedish):
You are Aqua's manager and supposed to plan the coming world tour - a task that takes both overview and planning!
You compete for becoming the player that first completes their Aqua world tour by visiting all cities, assigned at game start. During the game you will encounter chance-cards, where you will try your luck and thus you may get an extra dice throw or miss your next turn.
You will also have to answer questions about the group and the group members.
Much enjoyment!

85131.name: Objective: Stalingrad
85131.description:
From the publisher's website:

Objective: Stalingrad (OS) is a regimental-scale game of the two-month struggle for control of the 30-kilometer long industrial town that sat on the West Bank of the Volga River. In the fall of 1942, the very experienced German army was pushing further into the Soviet Union despite the serious setback inflicted on it by the Soviet winter offensive in December 1941. The Germans were now fighting a rebuilding Soviet army composed of raw recruits and some veteran units that had survived, and learned from, the battlefield disasters suffered by the Russians in 1941.

The German Sixth Army approached the outskirts of Stalingrad in September 1942 a little over two months into its summer offensive. Although his bombers had destroyed the city's industrial and transportation capacity in August, Hitler ordered the capture of Stalin's city. In Objective: Stalingrad, the German player starts with only sixteen regiments to accomplish this mission. The means to German victory is in the ground-attack Stukas and independent battalions of artillery, combat engineers, anti-aircraft (flak), and assault guns (StuGs) that can be attached to the regiments to devise the best tactical mix of forces to conquer Stalin's city.

While the German regiments were steadily reduced in strength and exhausted to impotence, dozens of untested, conscript Soviet rifle regiments and brigades were obliterated in the house-to-house fighting. Cards will provide crucial influential factors such as snipers, leader initiative, mine dogs, armored trains, and river flotilla warships.

In Objective: Stalingrad the German player commands up to twenty regiments of infantry, including panzer grenadier infantry, along with numerous independent units. There are four scenarios representing each of the major attacks launched by the Germans between 13 September and 11 November. There is also a multi-player campaign game. The smaller scenarios are designed to be played in three to four hours. (For a different approach, see Stalingrad: Verdun on the Volga. In VoV the German player can refight the four major historical attacks using up to nine primary maneuver units – divisions – at an operational level. The same scenario at that level can be finished in one to two hours.)

Objective: Stalingrad is about tactical choices for both the German and Soviet players. If you never had time to play Dana Lombardy's tactical company-level "monster" game Streets of Stalingrad, OS enables you to refight one of the most important battles of World War II in far less time.

85132.name: Modern Havok
85132.description:
"Well, Punk? Do you feel lucky?"
Rebel Minis is proud to announce our new 15mm modern skirmish game, Modern Havok.
Modern Havok is a fast paced set of skirmish rules for modern urban warfare. Designed for our 15mm modern miniatures line, these rules are based on the award winning Chain Reaction System by Two Hour War Games. Players control gangs, law enforcement or even mercenaries in a bid to control the streets. The PDF even has 3 starting scenarios designed by Ed himself!
Modern Havok is a standalone game and a great way to get started in the Chain Reaction system.

85133.name: Congo Bongo
85133.description:
From the back of the package:

You're on a jungle safari packed full of wild and zany adventures. Climb the cliffs to the top of Monkey Mountain as you try to reach the jungle's most mischievous gorilla. Don't get clobbered by the coconuts he'll throw your way. Watch out for menacing monkeys. Beyond monkey mountain, you'll come to Lazy Lake where you'll see raging rhinos and hollering hippos. Leap from lily pad to lily pad across the treacherous lake filled with ferocious man-eating fish and other jungle dangers, but be careful...one slip and it's safari heaven.

85134.name: Traxi
85134.description:
Traxi - Het grote verkeersspel (in Dutch) or: Traxi - The great traffic game

Aim of the game
TRAXI is an educative game, that in a relaxing and nice way tests (car)drivers, cyclers and pedestrians and learns them about presentday traffic. A game for adults and children, a game for young and old. An ideal addition to traffic education.

Short description
The trafficlights and trafficsigns can be switched by a shifting mechanism in the board. Drivers whom drive to fast or to slow must pay fines.
By driving wisely and by paying attention a player can earn money.

Winner
The player possessing the most money after the agreed upon playingtime wins the game.

85135.name: The Amazing Spider-Man (1989)
85135.description:
User Summary

Spiderman seeks to rescue his girlfriend Mary Jane who has been kidnapped by the super villain Mysterio. Navigate Mysterio's movie studio lair by toggling switches and levers while avoiding numerous traps and enemies. Swing and climb through over 250 screens to reach Mary Jane and defeat the evil-doer.

85136.name: A-Train 6
85136.description:
User Summary

A-Train 6 is the sixth version in the A-Train series.

85137.name: X-Men: Madness in Murderworld
85137.description:
The game is a side-scrolling arcade game featuring the X-Men. The original story takes place in Murderworld, a dangerous and deadly amusement park of terror. The X-Men, which include Colossus, Cyclops, Dazzler, Nightcrawler, Storm, and Wolverine, are pitted against their arch-enemies Arcade and Magneto. The game has over 500 action and combat screens, as well as some puzzle-solving.

Source: Wikipedia, "X-Men: Madness in Murderworld," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

85138.name: Britney's Dance Beat
85138.description:
User Summary

Britney's Dance Beat is a rythm dancing game released for Playstation 2. Be one of the 6 dansers competing for joining the world tour of Britney Spears.

85139.name: Emerald City Confidential
85139.description:
User Summary

Emerald City Confidential is an adventure game that reimagines the land of Oz using a 1940's film noir style. Petra, the Emerald City's only detective, is hired to investigate the case of a missing person and is soon mixed up in the land of Oz's dark criminal underground while meeting many familiar and new characters.

85140.name: ObsCure
85140.description:
User Summary

Obscure for PS2 is an action/adventure game taking place in a horrific universe. Terror screams are heared in high school corridors. Five teenagers want to know more about that. Unfortunately, that's not a decision that pleases the creatures hidden in the dark. Go and find out what's happening, getting the light where obscurity stands...

85142.name: Astonishia Story
85142.description:
100 years ago the Life Tree died and the elves began to die. Brimhil, the eternally youthful queen of the elves, gave up her youth to revive the Tree. 100 years later, in the present, elves are being mistreated by humans and a half-elf Francis De La Cross attempts to obtain the power of the god-like creature to turn the tables and restore Brimhil's youth before she dies.

A young knight named Sir Lloyd von Roiental is transporting a holy staff known as the Wand of Kinan. He is ambushed and the staff is stolen by Francis, and Lloyd goes off to recover it. Along the way, he is joined by several other people who join his quest for different reasons.

Source: Wikipedia, "Astonishia Story", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

85143.name: Nail'd
85143.description:
Nail'd is an upcoming off-road arcade racing game currently under development by Techland for the PlayStation®3 computer entertainment system, Xbox 360®, the video game and entertainment system from Microsoft®, and Microsoft Windows® PC.

The game focuses on ATV and dirtbike racing, with an emphasis on speed and tricks. Recent trailers have compared it to MotorStorm and Pure.

The game will be published by Deep Silver and will feature a soundtrack including bands such as Slipknot and Queens of the Stone Age.

Source: Wikipedia, "Nail'd", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

85144.name: Space Ark
85144.description:
Space Ark features three game modes Mission mode - The player plays through each planet in turn collecting all the DNA crystals, grabbing the bonus fruit and scooping up all the power ups and bonus level tokens, to maximize their high score and earn the elusive "Perfect" ranking. Complete each planet in turn to unlock further planets and allow access to additional Arkonauts.

Survival mode - The clock is counting down. The player must play through six levels, racing to unlock the exits as quickly as possible, before the timer hits zero. Time bonuses can be earned for playing well but the aim is to exit the level as fast as possible. Time remaining (plus bonuses) will be added up and this time will be available in the subsequent levels. Let the timer hit zero and it is game over.

Time Attack mode - the clock is ticking. Time attack is a race to set the fastest time possible, which can be compared to those of other players via the online leader board.

A split screen multi-player mode (same console/computer) is also available where two players compete to complete each level and win the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Space Ark (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

85145.name: Tippy the Turtle
85145.description:
Tippy the Turtle is a balance game in which players attempt to place colorful barrels on Tippy's tummy. A roll of the special die tells you which kind of barrel (small, medium, or large) you must place on top of precariously balanced turtle. If your barrel causes Tippy to tumble, you lose!

The game includes 15 wooden barrels in three colors, a single wooden die, a cloth tote bag for storage, and Tippy the Turtle himself.

85146.name: East Front II
85146.description:
User Summary:

East Front II is an update to East Front and a compilation of East Front and East Front Campaign CD 1: Winter War Expansion Pack.
Included are the 50 scenarios from East Front, all the material from the East Front Campaign CD 1: Winter War Expansion Pack, plus 50 new scenarios, as well as a campaign mode.

85147.description:
In final design stage. Projected 2017 or early 2018 release.

Fighting Wings game system (Volume 4) goes to the Russian front, modeling aircraft and situations from the German invasion of Russia in the Summer of 1941 to the fall of Berlin in 1945. 48 new aircraft ADCs (very few duplicates from previous games and if so these are updated with better information), two double sided maps for four unique playing surfaces and two full counter sheets of air and ground units, one half counter sheet of ships and playaid counters, plus the third edition rules and playa aids for the Fighting Wings system.

This game builds on the Whistling Death game Fighting Wings rules. All Whistling Death errata is incorporated and subtle changes make this sophisticated system easier to use.

220 plus scenarios planned, showing evolution of fighter combat, close air support and the low altitude air war that was the Russian front's primary characteristic. Much more emphasis on air-to-ground than in previous series. A number of air naval scenarios as well.

J.D.
85147.name: Wings of the Motherland

85149.name: Shock: Fantascienza Sociale (1.3 Version)
85149.description:
The Italian edition of Shock: has received from the author the permission to dub itself 1.3

The main changes, aside from a general cleanup and clarification of the rules text are:


Scales are renamed to Levers (Leve delle Prassi) with a slight change of wording to aid visualization.



A new rule for the Audience approval of the choice of Praxis



An all-new Actual Play example from a game we had in Italy, with extensive explanatory notes.



Completely remade illustrations, plus additional two page spreads, all done in grayscale with color details.


The book also includes a special preview of the upcoming Human Contact game.

85150.name: Get Fit With Mel B
85150.description:
Get Fit With Mel B is a video game under development by UK developer Lightning Fish Games. It will be the first game to make use of the Xbox 360's Kinect and the Sony PlayStation 3's PlayStation Move. It will also appear on the Wii.. It will be timed-exclusive to PlayStation 3.

The game is licensed by Fitness First.

The game is essentally a Fitness game, with Melanie Brown as the player's fitness coach.

Source: Wikipedia, "Get Fit With Mel B", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

85151.name: Fate/Extra
85151.description:
Waking up in a strange virtual world with no recollection of the past, the main character finds themselves forced to fight for survival in a war they do not understand for a prize beyond value; the opportunity to have one’s wish granted. With only an enigmatic "Servant" by their side, the protagonist will have to face both friends and foes in battles to the death in order to not only gain possession of a mysterious object known as the "Holy Grail", but also to find the answer to the most important question of all: "Who am I?".

Source: Wikipedia, "Fate/Extra", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

85152.name: Geon HD
85152.description:
GEON HD is a fast paced and frenzied arcade action game played on a selection of colourful 3D geometric grids.

How fast can you clear the grids? Roll your ‘GEON’ cube to collect all the pellets and score five goals. Deploy the unique abilities of various powerballs to give yourself a competitive edge.

You must race against the clock to win medals and become the GEON King. Post your high scores to the leader boards and beat your friends!

GEON HD features hours of gameplay and heaps of replay value as you play to beat your best times. Each of the 24 grids and mini game challenges require logic, skill and concentration, so flex your fingers and test your reflexes. Are you ready!...3,2,1,….GO!

Source: The Developer Website.

85153.name: Lufia: Curse of the Sinistrals
85153.description:
Unlike the previous Lufia games, this is an action-rpg game similar to games like The Legend of Zelda, Secret of Mana, and Kingdom Hearts. Gameplay is no longer turn-based; players can roam around freely and attack monsters without waiting for the battle scene to occur. Only one character can be playable on-screen. The player can choose a map to go to without fully navigating the map like Lufia: The Ruins of Lore. Players can equip armor and weapons that can give players unique abilities in combat. The game takes advantage of the dual screen. In certain battles or puzzle-solving, certain actions may be disabled or the top-screen is used to navigate actions committed by bosses. Characters do not gain experience from defeating certain bosses. Players can press the feather button on the screen to go back to the stage selection menu. Players can also hit the rewind button to go back to the previous dungeon. These options may not be available if an essential event is going to be triggered in that area. Like in all Lufia games besides the Lufia & the Fortress of Doom, The Ancient Cave returns.

Source: Wikipedia, "Lufia: Curse of the Sinistrals", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

85154.name: Planet Minigolf
85154.description:
The game features 144 uniquely designed holes which can be played as part of a single-player campaign or part of an online tournament against gamers around the world. There are four areas, Buccaneer's Hideout, Soho, Polar Station and Ancient Valley, with four 9-hole courses in each. They progress in difficulty from Warm-up through Pro, Extreme and finally Whacky. Power-up items are often available on the courses that allow you to control the ball in various ways to improve your score. Keys (bronze, silver and gold) are earned, by winning single-player tournaments on the various courses, that allow you to purchase wardrobe items and different putters and golf balls for the five characters available to play as. Players can also create their own golf courses and then upload the course online for other players to download similar to LittleBigPlanet.

Source: Wikipedia, "Planet Minigolf", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

85155.name: The Stock Market Game
85155.description: 2 to 6 players buy and sell 5 stocks. Each stock rises or falls based on others buying and selling as the game progresses. Also included rules for dividends.

85157.description:
DESCRIPTION:
Neon Nightmare is an expansion for Global Control. Now more players can unleash more power and mayhem, using additional strategic choices!

NUMBER OF PLAYERS:
2 additional players (Up to 8 in total)

PLAYING TIME:
Approximately 60 minutes

GAME ELEMENTS:
•Original Global Control game is required to play this expansion set.
•Creates more card combinations for additional strategy
85157.name: Global Control: Neon Nightmare Expansion

85158.name: Hogan's Last Stop
85158.description:
User summary
Adventure for Western 2nd edition. Played in and around a Hogan's Last Stop, a small sawmill town in New Mexico controlled by a bandit gang.

Producers summary (In swedish)
Rollpersonerna blir vittnen till ett oerhört grymt diligensöverfall och märker att förövarna försöker få det att se ut som ett indianöverfall. Rånet utfördes i själva verket av ett banditgäng vars ledare, David Farley, vill hämnas på alla som satt i den jury som dömde hans bror Roscoe till döden. En av dessa jurymedlemmar var med på diligensen.

När banditerna inser att rollpersonerna bevittnat alltihop och vet att "Indianöverfallet" bara var en täckmantel försöker de sätta dit rollpersonerna för mordet på en vicesheriff i en närbelägen stad. Rollpersonerna hamnar i stora problem och har inget annat val än att försöka bekämpa banditgänget. Samtidigt närmar sig hämndsagan sitt sista kapitel; mordet på den nu pensionerade domaren från rättegången, Damien Moon, som nu bor i området. Kommer rollpersonerna att lyckas genomskåda banditernas plan och rädda domare Moon i tid?

85159.name: Lawster's Lode
85159.description:
User summary
Adventure for Western 2nd edition. The year is 1870 and the location is the mining communities Lawster's Lode and Rico Silver in Arizona, there the silver as attracted the lawless.

Producers summary (In swedish)
En ung kontorist, Edward Stapling, vid ett litet gruvkontor övertalar en gruvarbetare, Creb Tallman, att hjälpa honom stjäla silver från deras gemensamma arbetsgivare. Tallman börjar dock umgås med ett gäng skumma typer och Stapling blir paranoid och tror att de planerar att lura honom på hans andel.

Därför gömmer Edward Stapling det stulna silvret. Creb Tallman anländer till mötesplatsen, den nyligen övergivna gruvstaden Rico Silver, med sina nya kamrater utan att hitta något spår av vare sig silvret eller kontoristen. Ilskna, förvirrade och frustrerade förhör och mördar de den enda kvarvarande familjen, i ett försök att få reda på var silvret och kontoristen tagit vägen.
Under tiden blir Stapling orolig över vad som hänt, eftersom dottern i den mördade familjen var hans fästmö och hon skulle ha mött honom i en närliggande stad. Han vågar inte ge sig iväg för att undersöka vad som hänt och hämta silvret ensam, så han hyr rollpersonerna som livvakter. Till rollpersonerna säger han bara att han vill bege sig till den övergivna gruvstaden för att undersöka vad som hänt med fästmön, och när de väl kommit fram får rollpersonerna ingen chans att ta det lugnt. Banditgänget är dem på spåren och kommer inte att vila förrän de fått tag på mannen som lurade dem på en förmögenhet i silver

85160.name: De svarta banden
85160.description:
User summary
Adventure for Western 2nd edition. Taking place close to the border between Arizona and New Mexico in the year 1871. The plot revolves around the hunt for a bandit gangs hidden loot.

Producers summary (In swedish)
Tre män rånar en bank i New Mexico. De kommer undan med bytet, men börjar bråka inbördes. Slutligen dödar de två underhuggarna Pete Clanton och Joe Blake ledaren i gänget. De gömmer pengarna i en gammal Navajo mesa och beslutar sig för att dra sig tillbaka till anonymiteten. De återvänder till sina familjer och arbeten i en vanlig småstad i västern. Clanton och Blake bestämmer sig också för att försäkra sig om att deras fruar skall få pengarna från bankrånet om de skulle dö. De graverar därför varsin halva av kartan över mesan på sina revolverkolvar.

Det visar sig att ledaren, Charles Brent, som de trodde sig ha dödat överlevde och nu leder en brutal och ökänd rånarliga som kallar sig "De Svarta Banden". Brent söker de två förrädarna för att ta tillbaka bytet. De Svarta Banden lyckas få tag på Clanton och skjuter ner honom. Emellertid lyckas den döende mannen kravla undan och in i rollpersonernas läger. Han ger dem sin revolver och ber rollpersonerna se till att hans fru får en del av de gömda pengarna, därefter dör han. Kommer rollpersonerna få tag på den andra revolvern före De Svarta Banden och kommer de att få tag på bytet?

85161.name: Blodspengar
85161.description:
User summary
Contains two separate adventures about bounty hunters and assassins. The location is Texas and New Mexico the Year 1872.

The first adventure Blodspengar is the store about an infamous former guerilla captain from the civil war, Morgan Stiller now living under the identity of one of his former enemies.

In the Second adventure En Yrkesmördares Heder, the mayor has released an rumour about a fictive gunman in the city. This soon attracts real gunmen and serious trouble.

85162.name: Dead or Alive
85162.description:
User summary
Contains three separate and unrelated adventures with the common factor that they all are located to Arizona the year 1873.

In the first adventure ’’’Balladen om Julie Fosters Död’’’ the players need to solve a murder case and to free a wrongly accused young man.

The players are drawn into an evil kidnapping in the second adventure ‘’’Livsfarlig Eskort & Gamarnas Dal’’’, there the black sheep of a family tries to get revenge on his father.

The players faces a gang of ruthless criminals posing as priests and nuns of a religious sect, in the third and last adventure ‘’’Herren Ger och Herren Tar’’’.

85163.name: Action! PC Football
85163.description:
From the Action PC Football store description page:

Action! PC Football is the most researched and detailed football game on the market. Play the game with the default settings or easily modify coaching profiles, leagues, teams, players, rules, and much more. Action! PC Football can be played head-to-head, against the computer, or over the internet! No matter which way you play, you'll enjoy the real football feel of Action! PC Football.

Quick and easy internet play.

Customizable game screen.

Easy to use league and team coaching functions. Create and modify your own leagues, teams, and players.

Detailed computer coaching and roster management tools. Easily make simple and complex coaching profiles.

Hundreds of standard and customizable reports.

Play teams from different eras*. See how favorite "old" players match-up against current favorites. *Seasons are sold separately.

85164.description: The expansion includes 28 track tiles and four expanded locomotive cards that replace the train tiles and six-sided die used in the base game.
85164.name: Days of Steam: Locomotives

85165.description:
Chess 1 was a hit, no doubt about it. Chess 2 seeks to build on the greatness of the original while addressing a few problems and also going in a new direction. There are now SIX ARMIES to choose from, rather than just 1, creating 21 matchups instead of just 1. There's a new win condition for crossing the midline of the board with your king (in addition to your grandpa's checkmates). There's also a bidding mechanic called dueling that makes memorized openings even more impractical, and emphasizes adaptation and reading the opponent's tendencies.

The Six Armies:

Classic (balanced)
Nemesis (favors pawns)
Empowered (favors knights/bishops/rooks)
Reaper (favors queen)
Two Kings (has two kings!)
Animal (wild card)
85165.name: Chess 2: The Sequel

85166.name: Tilt to Live
85166.description:
How do you play Tilt to Live? Just pick that bad boy up and tilt. Tilt for your life! Lure relentless red foes over to a handy, dandy nuke orb, then ram it and blow the bajeezes out of them. Think you can exterminate your enemies faster than they can multiply? Think again.

Source: The Developer Website.

85167.name: Deep Scan
85167.description:
User summary:

In Deep Scan you control a battleship. Your task is to destroy as many enemy submarines as you can by dropping depth charges on them from the left or right side of your ship. You have a sonar which informs you on approaching submarines and submarine depth.

You get more points for destroying submarines that are deeper in the water. Beware of the torpedoes they fire on you! The game ends once 10 submarines escape you

85168.name: Thunderground
85168.description:
From the back of the package:

Your mission is to use your Core Capsule to destroy all six nuclear bases located on the planetary surface. These nuclear bases are guarded by a protective force field and two deadly Core Ranger Tanks. You must be able to quickly maneuver your Core Capsule so that you can avoid or destroy the enemy tanks, strip away the force field, and blast the atomic bases with your laser fire. But you must hurry! You only have a limited amount of time to complete each round or you'll begin to lose your Reserve Core Capsules.

So get ready for thundering action as the pace becomes fast and furious. And make sure you prepare yourself for a few unexpected surprises!

85170.name: Tac-Scan
85170.description:
From the back of the package:

Streaking across the galaxy at Mach 24, your squadron is suddenly confronted by the deadly superfleet from the ghastly planet of Amn. Wave after wave of laser firing Ahmins, against your five starfighters of Bravo squadron.

The glare of laser cannons pierces the darkness of space as your squadron shrieks overhead in tight formation, 24 times the speed of sound. Can Bravo squadron survive?

Your ships can fire almost 300 rounds a minute. But only lightning reflexes and a sharpshooter's eye can save you as the Ahmins fly faster and faster

A word of caution. Don't miss the enemy's shimmering mother ships. Because Tac-Scan isn't just a game. It's interplanetary war!

85171.name: Up'n Down
85171.description:
From the manual of the game:

You're racing your BAJA BUGGER over a dangerous, treacherous road. But your opponents aren't just trying to win the race, they're trying to make it the last race you run. To stay alive, jump your BAJA BUGGER and land on top of your opponents.

Earn points by collecting flags, balloons and other prizes along the course. Watch out for PICK-UP TRUCKS and WEDGE CARS. They'll try to collide with you...and if they do, you're dead.

Fasten your seat belt and get ready for the wildest strip of road you've ever been crazy enough to drive.

85172.name: Little Busters-EX: DOTABATA Ranking Battle
85172.description:
The English name for this games is Little Busters-EX: DOTABATA Ranking Battle. As with other card games published by Arclight Games, this game follows the deck building system made popular by Dominion.

The theme of this Japanese card game is based on a 2007 Japanese visual novel and manga by the same name. According to Wikipedia, the story behind the game features a group of high school friends who go by the name, "Little Busters." Characters include Kudryavka Nōmi (クド, "Kudo"), Rin Natsume, and Saya Tokido.
'Little Busters!' on Wikipedia

In similar style to the physical fights depicted in the visual novel, players of the card game battle classmates against each other armed with slapstick weapons like volleyballs, sea urchins, cats and eel pie to accumulate points to win the game.

The base game consists of 300 cards and a copy of the rules in Japanese.

85173.name: Premier Manager 2000
85173.description:
User summary:

In Premier Manager 2000 you can choose hundreds of teams from five European countries and lead them through National and European championships. You have to deal with all aspects of team management, including field strategy and tactics, training schedules, transferring players, hiring and firing staff, financial issues, sponsors, stadium improvements, team psychology ... - you are in total control!

You can also experience the fruits of your efforts in superb 3D, with the commentaries of Barry Davies himself!

85174.description:
E5 = Exchange Explosion Evaporation Experiment Expansion is a new Expansion for your game of Experiment and introduces some new game elements and gives the possibility to add more danger to the game.

3 super-wildcards are now available but they come with a price.

Extra danger with an extra explosion and 2 broken bottles.

The black pawn and evaporation rules will give an extra boost to 1-point tasks if you complete them at the right moment.
Will you use the power to block your opponents or will you try to give yourself an advantage (and will your opponents allow this or will they try to block your advantage in return)?

New exciting options and new tactical decisions for Experiment
85174.name: Exchange Explosion Evaporation Experiment Expansion

85176.name: The Lost Kingdom of the Dwarves (HARP)
85176.description:
From the back of the book:

Undîm stood at the edge of the parapet, squinting off to the south. The wind fluttered his cloak, whistling above his armor and through his mail, stirring his beard. The sky arced blue and inifinite above him, making him feel alone and exposed, despite the surrounding troops. "Any word?" he asked.

Shand shook his grizzled head. "No, sir. Nothing since the refugees arrived at Athal."

Undîm growled and looked down the southern pass. "He's coming, I can feel it."

Shand squinted off tot he south as well. "Why wouldn't he take the underground road?"

"There's no room to maneuver. Better to expose yourself to ambushes from the surrounding peaks."

Whatever Shand was going to say next was lost when one of theguards shouted and pointed south. Undîm squinted harder and could just make out a cloud of dust creeping over a spur of peaks.

That's him," Undîm said.

Urzarâg. The name brings up images of despair, broken dreams and lost glory. It's the seed of evil, the home of a Warlord. It's a breeding ground for Orcs and the rallying point of armies. From here the Ords flow, waging war against the Mortals of the world.

This was once the greatest Dwarven kingdom in Balkanâth.

But glory is fleeting.

The Echoes of Heaven is designed for use in four different gaming systems. They are the d20 system game (owned by Wizards of the Coast), Rolemaster (owned by Iron Crown Enterprises), HARP (owned by Iron Crown Enterprises) and HERO System (owned by Hero Games).

85177.name: On Corrupted Ground (HARP)
85177.description:
From the back of the book.


It was the last days of the War in Heaven.

You have left the lands of the Faithful behind. This was the time before the sun and the moon, the time before night and day. Only the Holy See, in the destance, shone light for the world. A constant light, gentle and even, no matter how far one traveled from the Holy City.

Except for here.

But you have a mission, given by the Archangel Areniel. You are to penetrate as deeply as possible, to find the home of the Fallen Angel Mathos.

Here are the lands of the Fallen, the lands of the damned Angels and the heretic Mortals who follow them. Here the light never shines and the oppression is unrelenting.

Here, you will likely die.

Welcome to the third adventure in the Moving Shadow campaign. This adventure, On Corrupted Ground, is the third of a ten part series that will take a group of characters through the Mortal Realm.

The Echoes of Heaven is designed for use in four different gaming systems. They are the d20 system game (owned by Wizards of the Coast), Rolemaster (owned by Iron Crown Enterprises), HARP (owned by Iron Crown Enterprises) and HERO System (owned by Hero Games).

85178.name: Angeln 2010
85178.description:
User Summary

This is a fishing simulation from German origin.

The player first has to pick a starting location from 60 different locations from all over the world. After choosing a location, the background and boat are fixed and the player can concentrate on using his gear.

Caught fish generates point (based on size and sort) with which additional equipment can be bought and other locations be unlocked.

The game can be minimized and will then notify the PC user every time a fish nibbles on the bait, so he can jump back to the action.

85179.name: The Echoes of Heaven Bestiary (HARP)
85179.description:
From the back of the book.


Korum stumbled clear of the blast of air, his ears ringing, the skin onhis face raw from the merciless slap of wind. For a moment, he stood disoriented, then the training kicked in. Whatever else his enemy was, he was a witch.

The mountain pass crumbled and wound down the incline bhind him even as the dying light painted the walls of the cleft red and orange, gleamed off the blac armor of his enemy. The man stood, helmetless before Korum, sword held easily in one hand, the other still raised from his last magical blast.

No. Korum had to get out of here.

Foul and tainted creatures stalk this way.

Towering Nephilim. Wiked Cambions, Nobel Angels and fallen Devils. The legions of Hell. The dreaded Elemental Wraiths. Since the release of The Echoes of Heaven, our products have been filled with hints and descriptions of these creatures. Some of them are familiar. Some of them are wholly new. Look no further, because here you will find the creatures unique to The Echoes of Heaven.

The Echoes of Heaven is designed for use in four different gaming systems. They are the d20 system game (owned by Wizards of the Coast), Rolemaster (owned by Iron Crown Enterprises), HARP (owned by Iron Crown Enterprises) and HERO System (owned by Hero Games).

85180.name: Theater van het Sentiment
85180.description:
Theater van het Sentiment is a trivia game with questions about the sixties, seventies and eighties. Each turn, a player rolls a die to determine a question category. Then, he is asked a question from that category. If he answers correctly, he gains a score marker for that category; the first player who has a marker for each category wins the game.

The games is based on a radio show with the same name.

85181.name: Jack in the Dark
85181.description:
Jack in the Dark is a small game made during Alone in the Dark 2 production. It was used as a promotional game distributed at Christmas 1993 (just before Alone in the Dark 2 release). The game was on a single floppy in a golden wrapping featuring a Jack-in-the-box illustration on the top. It is a short adventure featuring the young child Grace Saunders. During halloween, she enters a small toy store after dark and gets locked in it. There, the toys are alive, and Grace must save Santa Claus from an evil Jack-in-the-box. Jack in the Dark is an adventure game that focuses purely on puzzles and has no combat. Later CD versions of both Alone in the Dark and Alone in the Dark 2 came packaged with Jack in the Dark.

Source: Wikipedia, "Alone in the Dark", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

85182.name: The Tainted Tears (HARP)
85182.description:
From the back of the book:

It was the last days of Heaven.

All of Heaven used to shine with the light of God, but as you poshed deeper and deeper into the Fallen Lands, all you saw was darkness and horror and rot. The Light of God did not enter these lands. It wasn't that it couldn't, but the God Himself had denied his most treacherous children the light. In the lack of light, the crops withered and faded, and the topsoil eroded. Winds whipped stinging sand across most of the land, all except those few fields where the Fallen Angels created enough light for plants to struggle into something resembling life. A treacherous, half existence.

There you walk, mile after mile of desolation around you. Few mortals live this far into the Fallen Lands. this is a place of the foul betrayers of God, the Fallen Angels. Around you, endless stretches of bitterness, hate and fury. The fate of those who'd risen against their Fallen.

Welcome to the fourth adventure in the Moving Shadow campaign. This adventure, On Corrupted Ground, is the third of a ten part series that will take a group of characters through the Mortal Realm.

The Echoes of Heaven is designed for use in four different gaming systems. They are the d20 system game (owned by Wizards of the Coast), Rolemaster (owned by Iron Crown Enterprises), HARP (owned by Iron Crown Enterprises) and HERO System (owned by Hero Games).

85183.name: Jolly Rover
85183.description:
Jolly Rover is a 2D adventure game that takes place in an 18th century pirate setting in which all of the characters are dogs. The game's story revolves around a sausage dog named Gaius James Rover, who is kidnapped by a crew of pirates, before becoming a pirate himself.

Source: Wikipedia, "Jolly Rover", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

85184.name: Bus-Simulator 2009

videogameversion.69880: German Windows XP / Vista CD-ROM edition

85184.description:
User Summary

This game simulates first and foremost being a busdriver. Besides that, the game has some simple bus compagny management features, but driving busses, sticking to the routes, abiding traffic laws and making the deadlines from stop till stop noted in the schedule is what this game is about. Anouncing the next stop, opening the doors, all the details of the bus driver's job are under a hotkey.
Driving is with 12 different kind of busses in a fictional German town on a number of routes.

85185.name: Hochseefischen: Die Simulation
85185.description:
User Summary

This game simulates being the captain/owner of a fishing boat: first the palyer has to find rich fishing grounds using his sonar, next he has to decide how to haul in the fish,m choosing from a number of real life possibilities.

Once back, the player can sell his load and invest in a better crew or bigger boat.

There are 12 different locations, each with different weather conditions, day times and fish.

85186.name: Schwimmbad Tycoon
85186.description:
User Summary

Schwimmbad Tycoon (an English release would probably be called: Swimming Bath Tycoon) is a management simulation game about managing a swimming bath. First the player has to build his location (including the option to designing his own water slides), put snackbars and other shops in for additional income, hire staff and after all that is done, open and watch his customers swim and spend their money. There's also a dynamic weather system which influence your customers (less people will swim on rainy days).

The game features 12 specific missions (goal to meet) and a 'free build mode' in which the player can just endlessly run his compagny and expand with new water features.

85187.name: Garbage Truck Simulator 2008
85187.description:
Get behind the steering wheel of one of the many different garbage truck models (incl. Rotopress, Variopress and construction waste trucks) and also on your feet to collect and empty garbage bins on one of the countless tracks in the fictional Urban City.

But keep the time schedule.

Your task is not only to collect trash bins, but also to solve special tasks like waste glass containers, contruction waste, toxic waste and more. And you have, of course, to manage your waste utilization company. Not only can you choose the corporate look (color, name, logo etc.), but also you can literally see your company growing.

Keep an eye on your personnel. Only personnel with enough experience can solve later tasks.

Choose between different garbage truck models and control both the vehicle and the garbage men! Let them collect and empty bins on your command.

An unlimited number of tasks through different districts (city, industrial, business centre etc.) offer countless hours of fun.

Features

* unlimited tasks in a huge megacity
* 5 different garbage truck models in 4 classes
* Tycoon elements (buying/renting, hire and fire, service, corporate identity etc.)
* large city model with traffic, pedestrians and lots of details
* different camera views including cockpit view
* highscore list and online highscore system
* different daytimes and weather conditions
* easy to use 3D interface
* can be controlled with mouse, keyboard, gamepads or wheels

Source: The Game Website.

85188.name: Player's Guide
85188.description:
Publisher Blurb:
As a player sometimes you don't want to pick up the rule book of your favourite game in case you flip to a page revealing the BIG secret your GM was about to spring on you! Well no need to worry now as we've cut out any important GM information and made this special All For One Player's Guide. Please note that if you already have the All For One RPG you won't need this player's guide because you already have all the information!

The year is 1636 and France is a troubled nation.

A great and terrible evil gnaws at its core.

Darkness stalks the land.

All that stands between chaos and order are the King’s Musketeers.

Explore a France of swashbuckling action, powerful magic, daring deeds, courtly intrigue, witty repartee, and vile monsters! The characters are France’s bravest and proudest defenders, the King’s Musketeers. Pitted against them is a plethora of corrupt nobles, black magicians, fell demons, and twisted secret societies.

Set at the height of power of Cardinal Richelieu and Louis XIII, All for One: Régime Diabolique mixes the action of literary works such as the Count of Monte Cristo and The Three Musketeers with horror and intrigue to create a unique, vibrant setting. The high-action is powered by Ubiquity, an innovative role playing game system that emphasizes storytelling and cinematic action.

Strap on your sword, salute the King, and prepare to fight the creatures of darkness!

All for One: Régime Diabolique Player's Guide give you all the information required to build your character. If you are planning to be the Games Master you will need the full All For One Rulebook. This is a players guide only from Triple Ace Games.

85189.name: Line Of Battle: Fleet Naval rules for the Age of Nelson 1760-1820
85189.description:
Allows players to recreate large fleet actions within 3 to 4 hours.

Covers all major and minor powers of the period with various rules to cover fire ships, transports, blockades and much more.

Line of Battle: Fleet Level battles in the Age of Nelson 1760-1820 includes scenarios and Campaign integration rules with Corps Command Campaigns

8.5x11, Naval rules for the age of Nelson. Covers all major and minor powers of the period. Includes scenarios, terrain rules, leaders and more. 1 vol, 58 pgs.

85190.name: Frederick d'Or: Rules for the Age of Frederick The Great
85190.description:
Covering the period from 1734 thru 1792, Frederick d'Or allows players to recreate the battles of the 18th Century. Includes army lists for all major powers, points system, battlefield generation system, leader lists, and rules that allow for action in Europe, Middle East, Africa, Far East, and in the Americas.

The smallest maneuver unit is a battalion for infantry, squadron for cavalry, and battery for artillery. Game scale is 1 figure = 50 men.

Wars covered are the Austrian Succession, the French & Indian War, the Seven Years War, the Turkish wars, and the American Revolution.

85191.name: Utopian Conflict
85191.description:
Players compete to build the best society and struggle from the earliest technologies to the technology of today. They attempt to claim great people and achievements before the others can, use their technology more effectively, and eek out more VP points.

Each player starts with a small deck of cards that represents their society. To improve their society they build new settlements and research new technology. These cards get added to their own discard and their discard eventually becomes their new deck to draw from. There are many paths to victory and ways to gain VP.

The game takes place in a limited # of rounds and attempts to give all players equal footing with a means to claim first player in the round order. A timeline of cards changes the game priorities every time and indicates the # of rounds left in the game.

Players collect resources based on their cards throughout the game. Resources stay from turn to turn to allow you to build up between turns.

The game will also come with a role selection variant to increase the player interaction and replay-ability.

85192.name: Premier Manager 2003-04
85192.description:
User summary:

Witness the excitement of managing all aspects of a soccer team! You can chose a team from among the top two divisions of French, Spanish, German and Italian leagues, as well as any team from all four divisions of the British league.

Being a management simulation, Premier Manager 2003-04 gives you the opportunity to take the fate of you team into your hands. Finances, player transfers, training sessions, firing and hiring staff, ticket pricing, stadium expansion, and of course the athletic success of your team, all are under your complete control.

85193.name: Strat-O-Matic Hockey
85193.description:
From the Strat-O-Matic website:

What is Strat-O-Matic Hockey?

For more than 30 years, Strat-O-Matic has brought the NHL to life. On your tabletop or PC, satisfy your craving for today’s high-speed sport of Alexander Ovechkin and Sidney Crosby, or one of two dozen older seasons rich in Hall-of-Fame players like Wayne Gretzky, Bobby Orr, Gordie Howe and Rocket Richard. Marvel as the big-name players lead your league in goals and assists, shutouts and save percentage.

Play year-round, and update your game annually with more than 700 new player ratings for the latest season. Strat-O-Matic devotes hundreds of hours to rate players in every facet – shooting, passing, defense, penalty frequency – even face-off skills and ability to intimidate foes. At a glance, see which skaters are more likely to earn breakaways, cash in rebounds and set up linemates with golden scoring chances. You’ll recognize the power-play specialists and penalty-killers. You’ll see which goalies are toughest to beat, but also which ones give up the most rebounds.

85194.name: Strat-O-Matic  Baseball
85194.description:
From the Strat-O-Matic website:

What is Strat-O-Matic Baseball?

Since 1961, Strat-O-Matic has created the most realistic simulation of statistically accurate baseball. No other game combines Strat-O-Matic’s realism, statistical accuracy and ease of play. That’s because no other game matches Strat-O-Matic’s in-depth research – up to 1,500 hours to recreate a season in supremely realistic detail. Easy enough to learn swiftly, Strat-O-Matic’s ability to capture all the variety of real baseball keeps gamers coming back for more – for decades.

This true classic is updated with the latest players every year. Every player is rated with statistical precision in every phase of his talent – batting, pitching, fielding and running. The real league leaders will be your top performers. The underachievers will hurt your teams just as they did to their big-league teams. Each player’s strengths – and weaknesses – will come to life before your eyes.

Talk about interactive – YOU are the manager! Whether playing solitaire or joining the many thousands playing Strat-O-Matic in leagues, face-to-face and online, YOU make the choices about who to play and which opponents to match them against. In Strat-O-Matic, the decisions you make all game long determine victory or defeat.

85195.name: Strat-O-Matic Pro Football
85195.description:
From the Strat-O-Matic Website:

What is Strat-O-Matic Pro Football?

Strat-O-Matic has created the most realistic simulation of statistically accurate pro football for more than 40 years. Every player is rated with statistical precision in every phase of his talent – passing, running and receiving. Offensive linemen are rated separately for run blocking and pass blocking. Defenders are rated on their ability to stuff the run, shut down the pass and sack the quarterback. The real league leaders will rise to the top in your games. The underachievers will undermine your game plan. Each player’s strengths – and weaknesses – will come to life before your eyes.

Like all classic games, Strat-O-Matic Pro Football is easy to learn swiftly, yet challenging enough to fascinate for a lifetime. Gamers keep coming back every year for the updated teams with the latest players, and for the endless enjoyment of Strat-O-Matic’s unique blend of realism, statistical accuracy and ease of play.

85196.name: Strat-O-Matic Basketball
85196.description:
From the Strat-o-Matic website:

What is Strat-O-Matic Basketball?

For nearly 40 years, Strat-O-Matic has created the most realistic simulation of statistically accurate basketball. No other game combines Strat-O-Matic’s realism, statistical accuracy and ease of play. Why? Because no other game matches Strat-O-Matic’s in-depth research – hundreds of hours to recreate a season in supremely realistic detail.

It’s all here in ratings that bring pro basketball’s superstars – and role players – to life. The dominant big men, the outside shooters, the penetrating guards, the intimidating shot blockers, the pick-pocket defenders, the dazzling playmakers, the fast-break finishers all strut their stuff in a game so real it will give you a front-row seat to the action.

85197.name: Comet Crash
85197.description:
From the official website:

Comet Crash takes real-time strategy to a new level by blending classical tower defense gameplay with offensive counterattacks and dynamic AI.

Choose among a variety of weapons to defend your territory. Use specialized units to fight off attacks. Build up massive armies and rush your enemies.

Challenge your friends in offline Battle mode or fight your way through action packed levels in Campaign mode.

85199.name: Title Bout Championship Boxing 2.5
85199.description:
From the Out of the Park Developments website:

OOTP Developments proudly presents the new version of Title Bout Championship Boxing, TB 2.5! Discount offer for owners of TB1 and TB2!

TB 2.5 is a milestone on the way to the role playing version of the game and will replace TB2. It includes a lot of new, powerful features, a completely redesigned database and a new graphics engine.

TB 2.5 comes with more than 6600 updated fighter records and is linked to our new online fighter database, which is constantly being updated by a team of dedicated volunteers. This way you'll receive changes and additions on your computer as soon as they have been added to the online database!

85200.name: Second and Ten
85200.description:
From the Second and Ten website:

Second and Ten is a football simulation covering both professional and college football. Version VII comes with many exciting new features.

85201.name: Atapuerca
85201.description:
To endure in Atapuerca, your Homo Antecessors must evolve. Expand your tribe and improve their abilities; teach them to harvest, hunt and fish; only in this way you’re your tribe survive.
