The "Drama" sequence occurs during waking hours, during which Vincent will choose between the two girls.

Hashino also said that "Vincent's character can change in many ways depending on the player’s choices throughout the game," and added "his character development can get pretty unusual."

The adventure segments in Catherine will consist of running around town and visiting various places.

It was stated by Famitsu that Vincent will not be alone in his nightmares and that he'll be encountering a large number of sheep. In a dream sequence the sheep, as well as Vincent, are being chased by a giant pair of hands, one of them holding a blood-covered fork.

Hashino has stated that there are multiple endings, and the first play-through of the game should last twenty hours, but in order to obtain all endings, it’ll take "up to thirty hours" to complete.

Source: Wikipedia, "Catherine (video game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

85402.name: Rotaris
85402.description: The board consists of a hex frame, a rotating ring inside the frame and a rotating centre piece. There are 12, 12, and again 6 holes in these, respectively. The 2 players rotate the ring, centre or both clockwise for 60 degrees and places a ball in one of the holes. To get 5 in a row is the goal, but the rotating ring / centre add complexity.

85403.name: Comanche 3
85403.description:
From the back of the box

The world's best-selling helicopter simulation is now bigger, better and badder than ever. Introducing COMANCHE 3, the totally new version of the world's most technically advanced helicopter, the RAH-66 Comanche. Rule the day and the night in the helicopter designed for the digital battlefield of the 21st century. The U.S. Army's concept of waging was is to dominate an enemy in space and time. Are you prepared?

User addition
For Comanche 3 NovaLogic upgraded to VoxelSpace2 to render the graphics. Besides that, the game features an easy and advanced flight model, this last with the help of the US Army and test pilots. So the game becomes more of an arcade helicopter game and a more hardcore sim at the same time, in contrast to it's pedigrees.
The game packs 30 missions

85404.name: Adventure Codex
85404.description:
User Summary: One of three core rulebooks for this system.

Publisher Blurb:
Forward! Brave the ironwastes, rule the skies, explore the arteries of the world and beyond!

Ambush your enemy, defend your airship, scout the borderlands, delve into mythic ruins and combat mighty foes! The complete rules of The New Epoch await you within.


Campaigns: Four great campaign ideas arranged into manageable chunks. Campaigns, Quests, Chapters, Encounters, Challanges!
Cities: Everything from humble thorps to hulking metropolises. Rumors and encounters, crime and punishment, acquaintances and annoyances.
Travel: 14 Unique landscapes to traverse, tables for generating random terrain features and weather.
Explore: 13 awesome environments to scour, loaded with details on doors, traps, hazards and common adventuring tricks.
Combat: Freestyle actions and tactical warfare -the guts of the system!
Injury: Simple yet diverse options for interesting damage. Steam, armor dents, scars, resting, status effects, diseases and more.
Rewards: Fame, spoils, experience, treasure.


Pave your way to glory in a world like no other!

85405.description:
The Catacombs: Cavern of Soloth Expansion is an exciting add-on to the original Catacombs game. Included in the game:

- Over 40 new wooden pieces
- 4 new heroes with unique special abilities
- 4 new Catacomb Lords
- New shot types

Over 60 new cards:
- New monsters for each family
- New items including some especially for the heroes from the original Catacombs game
- New rooms and special room cards

New 1000 gold currency cards

The Cavern of Soloth expansion requires the original Catacombs game to play.

From the back of the box:

"Dwarves mining in the Scavewyrm Pit have brought back news that the mythical cavern of Soloth has been discovered. Although unexplored, it is rumoured to contain exotic weapons and treasures from the reign of Soloth, the ancient Vampire Lord of the Underworld. Furthermore, sinister acolytes labouring in a forgotten labyrinth seek to reanimate Soloth's malevolent queen. In this expansion to the original Catacombs game, four new heroes set out to confront this impending evil and prevent disaster."
85405.name: Catacombs: Cavern of Soloth

85406.name: Equipment Codex
85406.description:
User Summary: One of three core rulebooks for this system.

Publisher Blurb:
A revolution of clockworks, steamworks, combustion and phlogiston.

Stoke your furnace, fill your boilers and wind your clocks. The New Epoch heralds the arrival of wondrous industrial age gear that will kick start your game.


Weapons: Hundreds of never-seen-before weapons
Armor: Fifty suits of armor and shields
Gear: Tools, Kits, Gadgets, Stims, Toxins
Style: Clothes, Vices, Jewelry, Enchanting
Services: Food, Drink, Lodging, Post, Education, Estates, Furnishing
Vehicles: Steambikes, Ironclads, Airships, Colossi, Artillery


Break the technology cap and power up your game!

85407.name: Character Codex
85407.description:
User Summary: One of three core rulebooks for this system.

Publisher Blurb:
A new age of industry, endeavor and unrest is upon the world. From the ashes of yesteryear arise a primed and ready breed of adventurers skilled in swordplay, sorcery and science. The New Epoch is an immense, action-packed role playing game set in a mechanical world fallen from grace.


13 Races: High fantasy bloodlines that have survived till the industrial age.
10 Classes: Arcanist, Bard, Berserker, Channeler, Explorer, Gunner, Mechanist, Necrolyte, Rogue, Warder.
7 Vitals: Agility, Power, Mass, Stamina, Ethos, Logic, Vigor
20 Skills: Detailing everything you can imagine in this dark steam-age setting.
26 Weapons: Censers, Clockbows, Gunblades, Scrolls, Steambows, Staves, Tomes. Radically new weapons as well as your tried and tested fantasy favorites: Axes, Sabers, Swords, etc.
400+ Abilities: Laughing Gas, Time Stitch, Counter Song, Dark Rage, Requiem, Twofold Lance, Cryptic Square. Each ability is absolutely unique.

85408.name: Richelieu's Guide to Creatures of Sin
85408.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Evil exists in many guises. From the Ankou, Death's lieutenant, to the fearsome Peluda of the Biblical age, this supplement details 11 new supernatural terrors for the All for One RPG, as well as two new mundane threats and a secret society of troubled souls seeking salvation. Additional material looks at the nature of evil, the rulers of Hell, unholy nights when evil holds great power, and much more. Strap on your sword, prime your musket, and prepare to face your worst nightmares!

85409.name: Thou Shalt Not Suffer
85409.description:
Publisher Blurb:
There are those who claim that witches don’t exist! They also claim that tales of curses and crop blights, of midnight sabbats and dark conspiracies, are the fevered imaginings of fanatical Witch Finders. Those people have never been to Cornwall.

In that wild and sea-girt land, the Witch Queen rules through sorcery and fear, and the Royalist majority seem to be in thrall to her evil will.

The Adventurers are sent on a mission to this bleak, remote and sinister place, where they must struggle through a maze of witches, wreckers and pirates, miners, fanatics and superstitious peasants, to find the truth behind a growing evil which could swallow up the whole of England.

Thou Shalt Not Suffer can be played as a stand-alone adventure, but also forms the second episode of the epic Kingdom & Commonwealth Campaign for Clockwork & Chivalry. Alongside a complete adventure are new rules for Witchcraft and information on those who practice it.

Requires the RuneQuest II Core Rulebook from Mongoose Publishing and the Clockwork & Chivalry Core Worldbook from Cakebread & Walton and Cubicle 7.

85410.name: Heavy Barrel
85410.description:
Heavy Barrel (ヘビー・バレル) is a 1987 overhead run and gun arcade game by Data East.

Gameplay

Terrorists have seized the underground control complex of a nuclear missile site, and it is up to the player to infiltrate the base and kill the enemy leader. Players begin armed with a laser gun with unlimited ammunition and a limited supply of grenades. Improved weapons and grenade powerups are made available within the game, either in plain sight or within crates that must be unlocked using keys. Additionally, crates may contain orbs or one of the six pieces of the Heavy Barrel superweapon. Like SNK's Ikari Warriors, the original arcade version featured rotary joysticks.

Source: Wikipedia, "Heavy Barrel", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

85411.description:
From the designer:
"The goal of the game is to enter into the underground layer of the dragon and make your way down to its lair. As you travel you will find various caves and wandering monsters. You fight these and explore things and you will pick up various items that will help you in your quest to defeat the dragon."

From the Rulebook:
"Your objective is to get to and slay the dragon. The game starts out with you on the Start Circle. You roll the dice and move your game piece the number of squares shown on the dice. It is your choice how directly you want to go to the dragon. You can go directly toward him or you can explore the various tunnels and caves along the way. If you land in a square with a number then look up that number in the RuleBook and follow the instructions. When you land in a cave you look up that cave in the RuleBook and follow the instructions."
85411.name: Slay the Dragon

85412.name: Geisterjäger John Sinclair: Dice Set
85412.description:
user summary in English

A ghost hunter is only as good as his equipment. Gear yourself with best, that you can get! The John Sinclair dice comes in a stable plasticbrick with 12 d6. The 6 is replaced with the "John Sinclair" logo.

from the product information page
Ein Geisterjäger ist nur so gut wie seine Ausrüstung. Rüsten Sie sich also mit dem Besten aus, was Ihnen zur Verfügung steht!
Die John Sinclair Würfel kommen zu je 12 Stück in einem stabilen Plastikbrick und haben an Stelle der 6 das Original "John Sinclair" Logo.

85413.name: DCS: Black Shark
85413.description:
"DCS: Black Shark" is a PC game of the Russian Ka-50 attack helicopter and is the first title in a new Eagle Dynamics and The Fighter Collection simulation series: "Digital Combat Simulator" (DCS). Following Eagle Dynamics' tradition of excellence, "DCS: Black Shark" will bring an even more realistic simulation experience than its predecessor "Flaming Cliffs". "DCS: Black Shark" will offer an unprecedented level of realism in regards to flight dynamics, instruments modeling, avionics systems, and weapon systems. The artificial Intelligence of ground vehicles and helicopters has been improved dramatically as well as weapon modeling. A new Mission Editor includes a powerful electronic mapping system that allows user to easily create missions and campaigns. A new campaign system allows the front line of the battlefield to move back and fourth according to your mission success or failure. Due to the increased flexibility of the DCS system, additional fixed-wing aircraft and helicopter add-ons will follow shortly.

Source: The DCS Game Website.

85414.name: Monsterkompendium IV: Rabenhorst Appendix

rpgitemversion.70333: Monsterkompendium IV - Rabenhorst (Die Kinder der Nacht)

85414.description:
The book is the german version of:
MC10: Monstrous Compendium, Ravenloft Appendix

combined with:
MC15: Monstrous Compendium, Ravenloft Appendix II: Children of the Night

The MC10 is part I of the book and the MC15 is part II.

From the back of the book
Sie lauern in den Schatten. Es ist Vollmond.
Sie schleichen sich in Ihre Träume. Nebel wallen auf.
Sie schlagen zu¸ aus der Dunkelheit. Das Grauen hat Sie gepackt.

Treten Sie ein in die wabernden Nebelwolken¸ und Sie werden Kreaturen von Angesicht zu Angesicht begegnen¸ die schlimmer sind¸ als Ihre Vorstellung es zu erfassen vermag. Seien Sie vorsichtig¸ denn wen die Nebel einmal umschlossen haben¸ der lebt nur selten lange genug¸ um die Kunde zu verbreiten.

Die Kinder der Nacht enthält bösartige und schreckliche Kreaturen der dunklen Dimension Rabenhorst¸ und sie warten auf Sie! Elfenvampire¸ Rote Witwen und viele andere Schrecken lauern in den Nebeln. Zudem bietet Die Kinder der Nacht eine vollständige Beschreibung von 20 einzigartigen Wesen¸ die man in einer RABENHORST-Runde einsetzen kann. Sie sind ideal als wichtige NSC oder Hauptgegner geeignet¸ denn diese Kreaturen werden Ihre Spieler noch jahrelang in ihren Alpträumen verfolgen.

85415.name: E.N. Classguides: Monks of the 9 Animal Clans
85415.description:
From publisher blurb:

Nine Clans.

Nine Masters.

Nine Animals.

Nine Fighting Styles.

Nine New Monk Variants.

One Monastery.

The Flincrest Monastery was founded 500 years ago on a mountaintop somewhat distant from civilization. Its founders were 9 men; the greatest monks of their age, with wildly disparate personalities. Each of these men had established a method of combat, and his own type of serenity, different from his brothers. Their leader, who would now be known as the Owl-Clan Master, made a simple treaty among these great masters; they would not attempt to kill each other, so that each of them could teach students and pass on their unique style of combat. Over the years thousands of students have journeyed to the monastery to learn.

85416.name: Ultimate Classes: Heroes of Code
85416.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tired of every Paladin looking the same?

Welcome to Heroes of Code, the first of five Ultimate Classes products revising and adding to the d20 fantasy core classes. Each product in this series presents 3 core classes, some new, some retooled from the base classes from the ground up.

What’s the big deal about these rebuilds? Choice.

Each class is presented with a variety of advancement paths to choose from – allowing each character to customize a class to suit his or her needs, drives and history. Now your paladin can be one of four types, and following one of six dedications which affects abilities granted at various levels and spells learned. Each class is presented with advancement charts up to level 30, including full epic advancements.

The first book in the series, Heroes of Code, details two new classes, the Knight and Scourge, and rebuilds the Paladin from the ground up.

85417.name: Gun-Fu: Balletic Ballistics
85417.description:
From publisher blurb:

Blam! Blam!! BLAM!!!

Gun-Fu: Balletic Ballistic is a brand-new d20 mini-game that lets players swagger through the hyper-violent, wildly stylized world of Hong Kong-style shoot-em-ups. Trenchcoats swirl and nickel-plated automatics blaze as bad guys die in truckloads. Heroes never run out of bullets (until the final showdown), bad guys get knocked down only to stagger to their feet one more time, and if you do go out, rest assured you’ll go out in a blaze of glory.

The first product in EN Publishing's new line of mini-games, Gun-Fu uses the Modern d20 rules as its starting point, but features an entirely new class system, a completely different hit point system and revamped firearms rules to create a distinctive, cinematic style of play that favours wild action over careful maneuvering. Characters have a Panache score that lets them pull off crazy stunts, but when used up leaves them vulnerable to their fatal Flaws. Players take the parts of dedicated police officers, ambitious Triad members or just folks caught up in the violence.

85418.name: Time Police
85418.description:
From publisher blurb:

Play a time cop, a chronologist or a period actor, travel back in time and fight villains intent on committing crimes throughout time!

Time Police is a d20 mini-game designed to let you and your gaming group try something different for a quick session, with the option of developing into a more long-term campaign. Time travel is one of the most classic elements of science fiction, and its mind-bending ability to mix anachronistic elements into the same story has the potential for memorable adventures. Crime in time is just the basis for this mini-game, and we encourage you to use this book to play all manner of time travel games.

85419.name: Cthulhu: Arma Ctuhlhiana - Dice Set
85419.description:
from the back of the tin, English

This high-quality metal tin contains an exclusive collection of dice especialy suited for the Cthulhu role-plaing game. This dice may of course be used with any other role-playing game, too.

from the back of the tin, German
In dieser hochwertigen Metalldose befindet sich eine exklusive Kollektion von Würfeln, die sich besonders für das Rollenspiel Cthulhu eignen. Sie können natürlich auch in jedem andren Rollenspiel Verwendung finden

user comment
the set contains 3 d6 (the six is replaced by the elder sign), 1 d20 with the one replaced by the elder sign. Also one d4, d8, d10, and one d%. The color is green/blue half-transluced.

85420.name: Figurines of Wondrous Power
85420.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Figurine of Wondrous Power has been a staple of the game since the first edition, with occasional additional figurines added to the basic 9 in the core rules.

Bring bring new figurines into your game with the first E.N. Treasure Troves PDF - featuring 30 new figurines of wondrous power, a few optional rules for these figurines, and the original figurines from the SRD included so you can keep all your figurines inone convenient package.

This PDF introduces new figurines such as the thieving Blue Baboon (on the cover), the unhallowed Carnelian Lizard, the lightning-empowered Copper Wolf, the disgusting Fistful of Rats, and the massive Oak Turtle.

85421.name: Teeth of the Ur-Lich
85421.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tales of ancient religions come and go, and the origins of few of them are remembered, the gods themselves having been long ago forgotten. But the priest-king of Mires Ford is remembered even by those who no longer remember where Mires Ford once stood, nor what ancient and strange gods were priest-king’s master. Tales make the priest-king to be the most potent servitor of the gods in the ancient world, when Mires Ford was a lush, tropical city, instead of the ancient necropolis of the Northlands that it is now. The ancient gods of those times granted the priest-king potent abilities unlike those seen in any other follower of the gods. He took the magics of the gods and rules Mires Ford and the lands around in their name, for century upon century.

As the world changed about him, the priest-king became more entrenched in his ways. As the ages passed, the people about him changed in their faith, and even the gods changed their ways. The Priest-King outlived his own gods as a lich, holding desperately to his seat of power and the divine energies invested in him.

But no lordship is eternal and even the Priest-King, now the Ur-Lich, fell aside, and was nearly forgotten.

But the great powers invested in his form by the ancient deities are still here, a last remnant of lost gods that none would otherwise remember. In the very teeth of the priest-king those powers were embedded, and those who would take the power of the gods for themselves can take these teeth and place them in their own mouths to steal their powers.

85422.name: Mythic Earth
85422.description:
From publisher blurb:

Elements of Magic — Mythic Earth gives you the rules to create magic as it is seen in the myths that are alive in every setting, ancient or modern. Mythic Earth presents rules compatible with both Fantasy d20 and Modern d20, and is an update of the flexible spell creation system of Elements of Magic. Additionally, whether you want to explore the myths of the real world, or you want to play in a fantasy world of your own creation, this book will help you understand the role myths play in history and society, and will aid you in composing adventures with mythic resonance.

Mythic Earth will help you bring the grandeur of myths and the intricacies of superstition and folklore to life in your games. From street magicians and voodoo priests to Chinese sorcerers and the various stripes of witches, all the magical beliefs of humanity and the infinite worlds of fantasy are yours to wield as you explore the mysteries of Mythic Earth.

Over twenty magical traditions are presented, drawn from the magical beliefs of our own world, though other traditions are easily possible for other worlds. Each magical traditions has some types of magic it is good or bad at, so Christian miracle workers are more likely to be skilled at healing, and Aztec blood mages will be most adept at attack spells. Characters of any class can learn magic, though only those who devote themselves to it will become truly powerful.

85423.name: GURPS Low-Tech (Second Edition)
85423.description:
From the Publisher:

Welcome to the Past!

GURPS Low-Tech covers the basic tools used by historical adventurers from the Stone Age to the Age of Sail – and still used by modern survivalists and post-apocalypse survivors when the high-tech toys fail.

Weapons and armor from antlers and rawhide to warhammers and heavy mail; adventure and travel gear from simple stone knives to early submarines; everyday items and tools of every trade. Low-Tech starts with the basics that suit any setting . . . and adds lots of culturally specialized inventions to support your campaign's particular flavor. For game masters, the discussions of past technologies – based on up-to-date historical and archaeological research – will be valuable no matter what system is used. For GURPS players, this book also covers the skills and traits that let adventurers make the best use of their equipment.

Whether the heroes are cavemen taking their first steps toward civilization, pirates on the Seven Seas, or anything in between, GURPS Low-Tech has the technology they need!

GURPS Low-Tech replaces GURPS Low-Tech for Third Edition, the TL4 parts of GURPS High-Tech for Third Edition, and the rules for equipment from many historical sourcebooks for Third Edition, from the TL0 tools in GURPS Dinosaurs to to the TL4 gear in GURPS Swashbucklers.

boardgamehonor.21109: 2011 Charles S. Roberts Best Best Ancient to Napoleonic Era Board Wargame Nominee

85424.description:
This is the new, 3rd edition of the venerable La Bataille de la Moscowa, the wargame that introduced "monster" as a genre in the hobby. Napoleon's battle near Moscow; September 5th to the 7th, 1812. Serried ranks of French and Russians clash on a narrow field where more than 1000 guns thunder and tear asunder man and beast. It was the single bloodiest day of battle up until WWI.

The scale is 100 meters per hex. 100 men per infantry strength point, 50 men per cavalry strength point and 2 to 4 guns per strength point for artillery. It has 4 maps and over 1400 counters.

This edition uses a new, simplified and faster playing set of La Bataille rules called Le Reglement des Marie-Louises (named for the French conscripts of 1814 who, in turn, were named for Napoleon's Empress; mother of his son). The game is also fully compatible with the advanced La Bataille rules called Le Reglement de l'An XXX.
85424.name: La Bataille de la Moscowa (third edition)

85425.name: Maan Roos Vis Geheime Woord Spel
85425.description:
A Fun and Educational Game for 2 Players!

Goal of the game: Find the secret word from the other player before he finds yours.

Rules:
Put the playingboard between the 2 players. Each player receives 16 chips of the same color. Choose a playingcard together to play with. There are 2 copies of each card, one for each player. Place the chosen card under the holes in your playfield. You can see all the words from the playingcard in the holes now.
If you choose a blue playingcard for example, you both choose a blue wordcard. You recognize your own wordcards by the white or black triangle in the corner of the card. Player 1 chooses a card from the stack with white triangles, and player 2 from the stack with the black triangles. This is your secret word your opponent has to search for. Put the wordcard against the sloping side of the playingfield, so your opponent can't see it.

The first player to guess the word from the other player wins. On your turn, you ask your opponent a question which he can answer with yes or no. For example: Does your word start with a "B"? If your opponent answers no, you can put a chip on every word on your playing card that does not start with a "B". This goes on until only one word remains. He calls the word and wins!

85426.name: The Labyrinth
85426.description:
From publisher blurb:

A thieves' guild on the threshold of dimensions!

Includes "Bring Me The Head of Alfredo Fonnori", a 10th level mini-adventure by John Simcoe.

When a minor smuggler miscast a teleportation spell, he found the key to grreater fortune in the Crawlspace, a small pocket dimension full of maze-like tunnels that sprung from a central courtyard. As he explored this strange new dark and dusty reality, he discovered that at the end of each tunnel was a plane-jumping portal that opened up to a new secret location on his home world.

Realizing what he had found, the smuggler began recruiting members for a whole new thieves' guild - one protected from every law, one hidden from every guardsman, one unconstrained by any border - because it was in a different dimension. With that, The Labyrinth was born.

Will you stop it? Will you join it? It's up to you: choose a side!

85427.name: The Blackcloak Watch
85427.description:
From publisher blurb:

CHOOSE A SIDE

Including "Corrosion of Society", a 3rd-level mini-adventure by John Simcoe.

The world is a dangerous place, and nowhere is it more dangerous than in the big city. Heroes and villains of all types and powers drop in on unsuspecting towns and turn the place upside down. The average peasant can only dream of the spells, powers and weapons in an adventurer’s arsenal. The real problem is when those dreams turn into nightmares and powerful beings use their abilities against the city. That’s where the Blackcloak Watch comes in to play.

They are the people’s defenders. They are the drunk-rustlers. They are the spell-stoppers. They are the crime-fighters. They are the conspiracy-destroyers. They maintain order. They want your help.

Will you join the Blackcloak Watch? Can you hide your crimes from them? It’s up to you: Choose a side!

85428.name: Kobe Bryant in NBA Courtside

videogamehonor.29624: 1999 D.I.C.E. Best Sports Game of the Year Nominee (Console)

85428.description:
Kobe Bryant in NBA Courtside is a basketball simulation game for the Nintendo 64. It was released in 1998 and received a Player's Choice designation after selling one-million copies. Kobe Bryant was in his second NBA season at the time of the game's release and was the youngest player to have a game to his namesake.
Kobe Bryant in NBA Courtside features 5-on-5 game play. The game also features 1997-1998 rosters and all current (at the time) NBA players (except for Michael Jordan), along with 3 game options: Exhibition, Season, and Playoffs. The game allows you to either simulate Season games or play them to lead into the playoffs, and win the NBA Finals.

Source: Wikipedia, "Kobe Bryant in NBA Courtside", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

85429.name: Česko, otázky a odpovědi
85429.description:
Zábavná hra pro zvídavé Čechy. Jak dobře vlastně znáte Českou republiku? V této vědomostní hře najdete 2400 zajímavých otázek týkajících se České republiky a jejích obyvatel. Otázky jsou rozděleny do šesti okruhů: historie, kultura, příroda/věda/technika, geografie, sport a různé. Během hry si nejen užijete spoustu zábavy, ale také se o své zemi dozvíte mnoho zajímavých informací. K tomu, abyste ve hře zvítězili, budete kromě znalostí potřebovat i trochu štěstí.

Fun game for the curious Czechs. How well do you know actually the Czech Republic? In this game you will find the knowledge of interesting issues in 2400 questions about the Czech Republic and its people. Questions are divided into six areas: history, culture, nature / science / technology, geography, sports and misc. During the game you not only enjoy a lot of fun, but also can learn a lot of interesting information about your country . Except the knowledge you need a little luck to win the game.

85430.name: Třináctá komnata
85430.description:
Thirteenth chamber (from the game cover):
Joint talking, laughing, that get together, we can learn a lot about myself as well as others. The way the game players pass through issues, tasks and rewards seven colors of the houses. Winner is the one who went through them all. The game can also be defined in time. We recommended to play Thirteenth chamber for more evenings.

Game description:
Players traveling the plan by rolling the dice and attend multi-colored houses. Each one represents one area of personal development. Upon arrival at the designated location, the player must accomplish the task associated with the sites and areas in which he moves. Once the task is finished, player gets a color card as proof of mastery of the area. Who gets the trophies from all seven regions first is the game winner.
Fields: Purpose, self-acceptance / concentration / center of personality, intuition / inner voice / spirit world, the mass / money / home, emotions / relationships / partnership / sexuality, love and security, self-expression / self-actualization

---

Z popisu na obalu:
Společným povídáním, smíchem, který sbližuje, se můžeme dozvědět hodně o sobě i o druhých. Cestu po herní růžici projdou hráči pomocí otázek, úkolů a odměn sedm barev domečků. Vyhrává ten, kdo je prošel všechny. Hra může být vymezena i časově. Doporučujeme Třináctou komnatu hrát dlouhodobě více večerů.

Popis hry:
Hráč dle hodu kostkou cestuje po plánu a navštěvuje různobarevné domy. Každý z nich představuje jednu oblast osobního rozvoje. Po příchodu na určené místo musí hráč splnit úkol, spojený s daným místem a oblastí, ve které se právě pohybuje. Po splnění úkolu získá barevnou kartu jako důkaz ovládnutí dané oblasti. První, kdo získá trofeje ze všech sedmi oblastí se stává vítězem hry.
Oblasti: Cíl, sebepřijetí/koncentrace/centrum osobnosti, intuice/vnitřní hlas/duchovní svět, hmota/peníze/domov, emoce/ vztahy/partnerství/sexualita, láska a bezpečí, sebevyjádření/seberealizace

rpgitemversion.70350: Non Cedere Al Sonno (edizione Dolore Dominante)

85431.name: Non Cedere Al Sonno (edizione Dolore Dominante)
85431.description:
user summary

A new, revamped edition from Janus Design, to celebrate the Best of Show prize of 2009 for the supplement Don't Lose Your Mind.

This edition features:

- Two New neighborhoods of Mad City with their nightmarish denizens.

- "L'Incubatore" ('The Incubator'), an alternative character creation method that lets you play Awaken that have already lost some of their sanity and wake with no memory in a creepy mental institution.

- "Incubo ad Incastro", a method for pick-up games of Don't Rest Your Head with a step-by-step procedure to create an initial situation, a common enemy Nightmare and the Awaken with a "snap-in" system.

Furthermore, the "Dolore Dominante" (Pain Dominant) edition features a revamped cover by Don't Lose Your Mind artist George Cotronis, plus a series of revamped AND original illustrations in color inside.

85432.name: Painkiller Universe
85432.description:
User summary:

Painkiller Universe is a compilation containing the full versions of Painkiller, Painkiller: Battle out of Hell, and Painkiller: Overdose.

85433.name: Action! PC Baseball
85433.description:
From the Dave Koch Sports website:

It Feels Like Real Baseball!

Whether you play games head-to-head, over the internet, or against the computer, you'll love the statistical accuracy and strategy of Action! PC Baseball. Loaded with strategy, extensive statistical reports, and revolutionary internet features, Action! PC Baseball is the most comprehensive stat-based baseball game on the market.

Quick and easy internet play.

Detailed computer manager and roster management tools allow you to easily make simple and complex manager profiles.

Easy to use league and team management functions. Create and modify your own teams, leagues, and players.

Customizable game screen.

Optional ball flight, fielder, and base runner movements.

Hundreds of standard and customizable reports.

Over 100 past seasons are available!

Play teams from different eras*. See how favorite "old" players match-up against current favorites. Every big league ball park since 1876 has its own statistical breakdown for every season it was in use! *Seasons are sold separately

85434.name: Painkiller: Hell Wars
85434.description:
User summary:

Painkiller: Hell Wars is a compilation released for Xbox and contains a mix of the best levels of the games: Painkiller and Painkiller: Battle out of Hell

Having died in a car accident, you find yourself stranded in the Purgatory during an infernal battle between Heaven and Hell. Fight an epic struggle against legions of foes, against overwhelming odds in a quest to gain purification.

85435.name: Action! PC Basketball
85435.description:
From the Dave Koch Sports website:

It Feels Like Real Basketball!

Whether you play games head-to-head, over the internet, or against the computer, you'll love the statistical accuracy and strategy of Action! PC Basketball. Loaded with strategy, extensive statistical reports, and revolutionary internet features, Action! PC Basketball is the most comprehensive stat-based basketball game on the market.

We offer every Pro Basketball Season and all nine ABA Seasons!

85436.name: Action! PC Hockey
85436.description:
From the Dave Koch Sports website:

The premiere edition of Action! PC Hockey includes the recently completed 2009-10 Pro season and is projected to release May 29, 2010.

Whether you play games head-to-head, over the internet, or against the computer, you'll love the statistical accuracy and strategy of Action! PC Hockey. Loaded with strategy, extensive statistical reports, and revolutionary internet features, the premiere edition of Action! PC Hockey is

85437.description:
Yet another packaging of Guggenheim/Categories.

A spinner determines what five categories and the five initial letters will use. The players have three minutes to complete their grids. When time has elapsed, each player may choose any square on one's grid for a free ten points. Players, then, compare answers. Ten points are scored for each unique answer. Each player scores five points for each duplicated answer. There is no penalty for illegal or no responses.

The player with the most points is the winner.

One interesting note: the game's catalog number is 666.
85437.name: Think Tank

85438.name: Clean Up, Aisle Four!
85438.description:
from the introduction

This modern day adventure pits the intrepid investigators against an evil plaguing a New England convenience store. An evil other than ancient hot dogs and high gas prices, of course.
The adventure is intended to be the first in a short series of adventures centering around a convenience store which will be known collectively as "Convenience Store Cthulhu."

The adventure is also intended as a "starter" adventure and is suitable for new investigators. It does not require that the investigators have any special skills or knowledge and does not pit the investigators against a major mythos threat.

85439.name: The Bookstore
85439.description:
from the introduction

This short adventure is intended to provide the investigators with a minor challenge and to introduce them to a useful NPC. This adventure is intended to lead to a series of adventures, but can be run on its own.

85440.description:
5 additional characters to expand the mix in the game in all new directions!

In both English and German language

New characters include:
The Carpenter - Someone to take care of all that excess lumber you lug around...
The Money Lender - A little extra bump for those volatile stock markets...
The Porter - Too much to sell? Not a problem...
The Docks Master - Well, well, look at what fell off that last shipment...
The Minstrel - the musical key to marketing those hard to sell items...

(Also includes the revised tax collector card!)
85440.name: Masters of Venice: Mini-Expansion Set

85441.name: Painkiller: Resurrection
85441.description:
User summary:

Painkiller: Resurrection is a stand-alone game, following in the steps of the original Painkiller but having a new protagonist and offering a new gameplay style, new enemies and new weapons. The company of an ally, whose voice guides you through the game is also a new feature.

You play the role of former CIA agent William "Wild Bill" Sherman. After having failed completely in your last mission, which led to a bus full of civilians' as well as your deaths, you find yourself stranded in Purgatory.

Female spirit Elyahim takes a liking on you however, and guides you through the unholy realm in a quest to "purge" the Purgatory, by eliminating the major demons.

There are three possible endings, based on the story's development. You are bound to experience hours of excitement and terror in your epic struggle against overwhelming odds. Can you make it to the best ending possible?

85442.name: Everyday Genius: SquareLogic
85442.description:
Source: The Publisher Website.

The next generation of puzzle games is here! Combining simple arithmetic with colorful cages and logical problem solving, this new puzzle game makes sure you never have to guess—and you don’t have to be a math wiz!

Everyday Genius: SquareLogic can calculate and display possible solutions automatically—allowing you to spend more time playing and less time tediously jotting down possibilities. With puzzles ranging from first-grade easy to astrophysicist hard, you’ll progress along the path to enlightenment as you build your problem-solving brain power with Everyday Genius: SquareLogic.

85443.description:
Chez Goth - Necronomicon is the Promocard number 04 from Pegaus Spiele. It is a slack 3, cost 3 card - class thing (book)

"Es zu lesen, ist relativ ungefährlich, man darf nur auf keinen Fall daraus zitieren..."

translates as:

"To read it is not dangerous, one should under no circumstance quote it though"
85443.name: Chez Goth: Promokarte Necronomicon

85444.name: Panzer Killer!
85444.description:
User summary:

An endless array of missions and combat situations comprise this exciting World War 2 tank simulation. Play the role of several different American tanks, avoid mines and shoot anything remotely resembling the Third Reich. It will take loads of valor and coordination to go against behemoths such as the legendary Tiger or the Panther.

Destroy enemy positions and engage in ferocious firefights, all dressed in realistic battle sounds. Relive the excitement and feel the tension rising in your veins as you blast your way through 1944 Normandy.

85445.description:
From Fantasy Flight's Website :

"The people of the Realm are variegated: there are lazy nobles and skilled craftsmen, fiery soldiers and humble peasants. A wise governor knows which group to favour at the right time to get as many benefits as possible for his own career."

This official scenario for "Kingsburg" allows the players to choose archetype roles each years to specialize their talents.
85445.name: Kingsburg: Wheel and Deal

85446.description:
From Fantasy Flight's Website :

"On the northern edge of the Realm lies a valley inhabited by several belligerent goblin tribes. While they spend most of their time fighting against each other, they are also always ready to assault any settlers trying to establish a foothold in this land."

This official scenario for "Kingsburg" creates a second deck of Invaders called the Valley Deck. During each winter, if the top card of the Valley Deck turns out to be a Goblin card, it makes the Invader attack that much more powerful, and hurt even more.
85446.name: Kingsburg: Goblin Valley

85447.description:
From Fantasy Flight's Website :

"The royal Advisors are constantly meddling with each other, creating fragile alliances that rise or crumble as situations evolve or their needs change. Choosing who to trust and who cannot be ignored is a vital skill for a successful governor."

This official scenario for "Kingsburg" creates a system of changing and mitigating alliances with the various Advisors in the game. Players score victory points when other players influence an Advisor that you are allied with.
85447.name: Kingsburg: Shifting Alliances

85448.description:
From Fantasy Flight's Website :

"The Realm is growing and so is the capital city! While the governors of the peripheral fiefs may not see it often, the King expects regular tributes to contribute to its expansion... or he could forget to send his soldiers to protect the borders"

This official scenario for "Kingsburg" implores a system for contribution to the King, as well as positive and negative outcomes depending on if you make the tithes or not. It requires the use of counters of your choice to be used as "Growth Counters" (e.g. pennies, cubes, etc...)
85448.name: Kingsburg: The Demanding Capital

boardgamecompilation.22172: Arkham Horror: Curse of the Dark Pharaoh Expansion

85449.description:
From Fantasy Flight's website :

"Know, O Thief, that these things are mine. For I am the Dark Pharaoh, him of the Crawling Chaos. Take what is mine and your blood will boil in your skin. As I reveal to you my Other Faces and my True Glory."

This is an official Herald, published by Fantasy Flight Games (originally only on the website, later also in Arkham Horror: The Curse of the Dark Pharaoh Expansion (Revised Edition)), to be used when using the Herald / Guardian mechanic in games of "Arkham Horror".

Rules Summary :

When the Dark Pharaoh is the Herald, place the Dark Pharaoh monster token in the monster cup at the start of the game even if Nyarlathotep is not the Ancient One.

Know O'Thief : Each time an investigator gains a Unique item (including starting equipment) that investigator loses 1 sanity.

These Things are Mine : Each time an investigator gains an Exhibit item, roll a die. On a failure that investigator is Cursed.

Blood Will Boil : At the start of the Upkeep phase, before rolling for Curses, each Cursed investigator loses 1 stamina.

My Other Faces : All Mask monsters gain 1 toughness. In addition, each time a Mask monster is defeated, add one Doom token to the Ancient One's Doom track.

My True Glory : If Nyarlathotep is the Ancient One and he awakens, his combat modifier increases by 1 (to -5, -6, etc) and he has one extra doom token placed on his doom track (for a total of 12, 13, etc) for each Mask monster on the board.
85449.name: Arkham Horror: The Dark Pharaoh (Herald)

85450.description:
From Fantasy Flight's Website :

Let me tell ye suthin - Some day yew folks'll hear a child o' Lavinny's a-callin' its father's name on the top o' Sentinel Hill! - Wizard Whateley

This is an official Herald, published by Fantasy Flight Games (originally only on the website, later also in the Arkham Horror: Miskatonic Horror Expansion), to be used when using the Herald / Guardian mechanic in games of "Arkham Horror".

Rules Summary :

When the Dunwich Horror is the Herald, place one Dunwich Horror token on the Dunwich Horror track at the start of the game. You must use the Dunwich board to use this Herald.

Unnatural Growth : The Dunwich Horror track starts out with one token on it at the start of the game and one additional token is placed on it when the terror level reaches, 3, 6, and 9. This is in addition to the normal conditions under which tokens are added to it.

Yog-Sothoth's Child : The Dunwich Horror is considered to have a circle dimensional symbol as well as a moon dimensional symbol, but only for purposes of movement. It cannot be banished or pulled through a gate because of this symbol.

Father's Name : When the Dunwich Horror moves, it adds a doom token to the Ancient One's doom track on a 3-6 instead of a 4-6.

Father and Son : If Yog-Sothoth is the Ancient One, and he awakens while the Dunwich Horror is on the board, Yog-Sothoth's combat modifier increases by 3 (to -8) and he has five extra doom tokens placed on his doom track (for a total of 17).
85450.name: Arkham Horror: The Dunwich Horror (Herald)

85451.description:
From Penny Arcade comes the fabled Investigator Johnathan "Gabe" Gabriel, Investigator Tycho Erasmus Brahe, and Guardian Anne-Claire. These are official expansions from Fantasy Flight Games to be used with games of "Arkham Horror".

Investigator Johnathan "Gabe" Gabriel

Rules Summary :

Home -- River Docks
4 Sanity
6 Stamina
2 Focus

Fixed Possessions : $6
Random Possessions : 2 Common Items, 1 Unique Item, 1 Skill

Fists of Fury : Any Phase -- Gabe gains a +2 bonus to Combat Checks.

Fists of Rage : If the Doom Track is within 3 spaces of awakening the Ancient One, Gabe automatically passes all Will checks.

Never Again : Tycho no longer allows Gabe to use any Weapons.

Speed -- 1 2 3 4
Sneak -- 4 3 2 1
Fight -- 4 5 6 7
Will -- 4 3 2 1
Lore -- 0 1 2 3
Luck -- 3 2 1 0

Investigator Tycho Erasmus Brahe

Rules Summary :

Home -- The Library
6 Sanity
4 Stamina
2 Focus

Fixed Possessions : $5, 1 Common Item (Tommy Gun), 1 Unique Item (The King in Yellow)
Random Possessions : 2 Unique Items, 1 Skill

Multi-Tasker : Any Phase -- Tycho reduces all movement costs on Tomes to 0.

Rational Man : Any Phase -- Tycho may spend 1 Clue token instead of losing 1 Sanity or 1 Stamina. He may do this as often as he likes but may not use this ability during the Final Battle.

Speed -- 1 2 3 4
Sneak -- 4 3 2 1
Fight -- 0 1 2 3
Will -- 5 4 3 2
Lore -- 2 3 4 5
Luck -- 3 2 1 0

Guardian Anne-Claire

Mechanical Genius : Investigators may always use the location ability of the Administration Building, regardless of other effects.

Cruel Taskmistress : Investigators receive a $1 discount when using the Administration Building's location ability for each Weapon or monster trophy they discard.

To the Rescue : Once per game, after an investigator has made a Combat check, the players may choose to have Anne-Claire show up to help out with her flamethrower. She adds 3 successes to the result of the Combat check.
85451.name: Arkham Horror: Penny Arcade Characters

85454.name: Byg
85454.description:
A 2 player abstract game, played with white and black stones on a Hexhex board. The goal is to have the largest group on the board when the game ends and the board is full. There is a trick, though: You can place as many stones per turn as you have groups on the board (up to a limit). There's a tricky balance: you need to connect your groups together to advance toward the goal, but you can't connect them too much or else you won't be able to place as many stones as your opponent.

The current rules:

1. The board begins empty.

2. To begin, White puts a single stone on any vacant space, and then Black does the same.

3. From then on, starting with Black, the players take turns. On your turn you may place as many stones as you have groups on the board, and you may place them onto any vacant spaces. Except:

*You must place at least one stone.
*The stones you place may not be adjacent to one another.
*If you have more than 3 groups on the board, the maximum number of stones you may place is 3.
*You may not grow any group by more than one stone.
*A stone connecting two or three different groups together is considered to have grown them all (at the end of your turn, no group may have more than one new stone in it).

4. The game ends when the board is full and the player with the largest group wins. If the players’ largest groups are the same size, compare their second-largest groups, and so on, until you come to a pair which aren't the same size. Whoever owns the larger group wins.

85455.name: Fans de Hockey
85455.description:
Fans de hockey is unique and is played during a televised hockey game. Goal, Penality, Powerplay, play your card during the add break.

Each card you have has Shot point, If a player get a penalty, play your penalty card to get 3 shot, if the player is a defense and you have the defense bonus on that card, you get an extra 3 shot. If your team has a power play, play your power play card and get 3 shot, a goal card is 7 shot. Some card let you draw other card has bonus and some of them give you extra shot if the event was done by a certain player.

A great card game for "Fans de Hockey" (Hockey Fans) who want to watch the game and play at the same time.

85456.name: Santa Claus vs. The Easter Bunny
85456.description:
A tactical game for 2 players.

So Santa and the Easter Bunny were sitting down in a cafe, drinking lattes, and Santa casually mentions that Christmas is more exciting that Easter. To which the Easter Bunny says that Easter brings more joy and happiness than Christmas. Santa, slightly miffed, says "Oh, I doubt that!". The Easter Bunny suggests "Perhaps a friendly contest is in order then. Let's see who can bring the most happiness, joy, and excitement to the children this year!". Santa chugs his latte and says to the Easter Bunny: "Bring it!!!" And the game was on!

This game is a print and play game for two players. It was designed to be relatively quick (29 turns; all quick) and be easy on the print cartridge. It also has basic strategy that may not be apparent at first. All images were public domain and taken from

The game consists of a series of bidding contests in which the winner of each contest receives a card. Cards that are won will later be used in future bids for new cards. Most contests are won by playing a card with high Excitement, Joy, or Happiness. Each card will have numbered values for each of Excitement, Joy, or Happiness.

Online play will be available shortly on Vassal.

85457.name: Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom
85457.description:
Indiana Jones and The Temple of Doom is a 1985 action arcade game developed and published by Atari Games, based on the 1984 film of the same name, the second film in the Indiana Jones franchise. It is also the first Atari System I arcade game to include digitized speech, including voice clips of Harrison Ford as Indiana Jones and Amrish Puri as Mola Ram, as well as John Williams' music from the film.

Ports

The arcade game was later ported by U.S. Gold to the Amstrad CPC, Commodore 64, MSX and ZX Spectrum (developed by Paragon Programming) in 1987. During the same year, Mindscape ported it to the Atari ST and the Commodore 64 (different compared to U.S. Gold's version). In 1989, Mindscape ported it to the Commodore Amiga and personal computers that use MS-DOS. The most well-known home console port is the one for the Nintendo Entertainment System. The NES version was ported by Tengen in December 1988.

The Nintendo Entertainment System

Nintendo of America sought to capitalize on both the success of its Nintendo Entertainment System and the Indiana Jones franchise by porting the game to its popular console. The resulting product differed from the arcade version in several aspects, but kept the same underlying premise and style. The plot of the NES version follows the storyline of the original movie.

By December 1988, there were two versions of the game available, distributed by Tengen and Mindscape, although the software itself was identical. After a lawsuit, Tengen's unlicensed version was pulled from the shelves and Mindscape's became the standard. Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom gives the player control of Indiana Jones as he makes his way through the temple in a series of 12 levels or "waves." In the final wave, the player must defeat the villain of the film, Mola Ram, on a rope bridge that recreates the final scene in the movie. Reception of the game was generally negative.

Differences in the Console Version

There are several differences between the arcade game and its console adaptation. In the original arcade version, the Sankara Stones were not all found in one location at the end of a wave. Instead, Jones had to travel through a temple every two rounds. In addition, the entire style of play is different and bestows upon the player more weapons and items for Jones to collect from the slave children he frees. Jones was also unable to jump in previous incarnations of the game.

The original arcade version was the first Atari System 1 game to talk to the players using speech capability, a feature lacking in the console version due to the limitations of the hardware. The arcade game, like the console adaptation, obtained its theme music (as well as sound effects that were absent on the NES version) from the film itself.

Skyler Miller, a reviewer at Allgame who compared the console adaptation to the original game, admitted that the graphics are "recognizable," but claims that the version is "missing the much of the original's detail and character." Miller's final judgment is to call it "a passable effort" and to compare unfavourably to the arcade version.

Source: Wikipedia, "Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom (Nintendo Entertainment System)" and "Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom (arcade game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

85459.description:
This small bonus expansion for Irondale was distributed with some of the early preorders. It adds a single new building, the Mill of Fortune. (3 are included, one for each deck)

When the Mill of Fortune is built, the player names a building type and draws one card from each deck. Each drawn card that matches the named type is taken into the player's hand, the others are discarded.
85459.name: Irondale: Mill of Fortune

boardgamefamily.5818: Small Box Games Pure Card Line

85461.name: The Exhibit
85461.description:
In this adventure,the investigators will be drawn into the action by a series of tragic deaths in and around a major museum. The investigators will face an ancient horror from Africa and they must stop it before it is able to blend into modern society.

(From the introduction)

85462.name: Finger Biter
85462.description:
from the introduction

This is a short, but nasty, adventure for a small group of investigators. It is set in 1920s Scotland, but can easily be modified for use in other times and places.

The adventure is ideal for times when a short, one session adventure is needed, or as a break between larger adventures.

85464.name: Fungus
85464.description:
from the introduction

This adventure pits the intrepid investigators against a non-mythos menace in the 1990s. Construction workers building a resort on a remote tropical island encounter a horrible fungus which spells doom for them and possibly the investigators as well.

This adventure can be modified by the Keeper to fit into different times and places, such as the 1920s.

85466.name: Goddess
85466.description:
from the introduction

This modern era Call of Cthulhu adventures pits the intrepid investigators against an ancient evil hiding behind a facade of environmentalism. This adventure is fairly dangerous for the involved investigators and is recommended for an experienced party with a good mix of fighting and magical skills.

This adventure may be set in almost any location, provided the required woods are available. While the adventure is written in a North American context, it may be modified for other locations and ambitious Keepers may modify it for use in other times.

85467.name: Anno Domini: Im Osten
85467.description:
Each Anno Domini set consists of 336 cards, with a description of a historical event on one side of the card, and the year (and sometimes specific date) in which it happened on the other.

Each player receives nine of these cards (or less, if you want the game to be shorter), and may only look at the descriptions. Players then put in turn a card on the table, *trying* to put theirs in chronological order. A player may, instead of adding a card, claim that the order in which the cards were put is incorrect. In this case all cards are turned over and the correct years revealed.
If the order was correct then the doubting player receives two cards and skips a turn. If the order was incorrect then the previous player, who accepted the order as correct, receives three cards. The first player that gets rid of all the cards wins.

Bluffing is as least as important as knowledge in this game. Most events are rather obscure or are hard to date exactly, so this ain’t no game for the nerds/geeks of this world, even they might think so, because it’s full of surprises and pure fun. Highly recommended, because Anno Domini is a blast to play, is a very enjoyable social event and you even learn something from it.

Unfortunately there is no English edition in existence, but this game could be a good way, to improve your already existing German skills or a very good reason, to learn German language in the first place.

The set "Im Osten" contains historical events which are related to Asia. This relationship is not necessarily obvious. Like all Anno Domini the "Im Osten" edition can be played as standalone or mixed with some or even all editions.

Part of the Anno Domini series

85468.description:
At heart, Anno Domini: Fussball is like every other Anno Domini game: Each edition of the game includes 336 cards, with a description of a historical event on one side of the card, and the year (and sometimes specific date) in which that event happened on the other.

At the start of the game, each player receives nine cards and may look only at the descriptions. In turn, players place a card on the table, trying to place theirs in chronological order with what's already on display. A player may, instead of adding a card, claim that the current order of cards is incorrect. In this case all cards are turned over and the correct years revealed. If the order was correct, the doubting player receives two cards and ends his turn without playing anything; if the order was incorrect, then the previous player – who had accepted the order as correct – receives three cards. The first player to rid himself of cards wins.

Bluffing is as least as important as knowledge in Anno Domini as most events are rather obscure or are hard to date precisely. As you might expect, Anno Domini: Fussball contains historical events related to football (i.e., soccer for those in the U.S.), and the relationship of events to dates is not necessarily obvious. Like all Anno Domini games, the Fussball edition can be played on its own or mixed with any number of other Anno Domini editions.
85468.name: Anno Domini: Fussball

85469.description:
Players are bath attendants in ancient Rome that are vying for the title Balneator. Whoever wins will rule the baths of the Roman Empire and earn riches. In this decisive duel, the players must adjust the baths in the municipal therme to the correct temperature before their opponent does.

Also required to play:
6 dice, 3 each in 2 colours
7 tokens, as awards for correctly heating a bath
2 pawns, one red and one blue

Players take turns to perform both of the following actions in this order:

1. a) Move a Therminator (red or blue pawn) OR b) change the value of one of your dice

2. Move one of your dice

1. a) Move a Therminator in one direction vertically, horizonatally or diagonally as far as you want to an empty space. If it moves directly over a die or ends its move next to one, the value of that die is changed by +1 for the red and -1 for the blue Therminator. However, dice in the central bath are never affected.

1. b) Increase the value of one of your dice up or down by 1.

2. Move one of your own dice vertically or horizontally exactly the number of squares as the value of the die. You may change direction while moving, but may not step on the same space twice during your turn. You may only move over empty spaces. If any entered space is adjecent to a Therminator, adjust the value of the die as above after completing the move.
If you can reach a die of your opponent exactly with your move, you may displace it. You choose the new location, your opponent chooses the new value.
If your die shares the value with a bath and can move there in that exact number of spaces, you may end your move there and you receive the corresponding token.

The first player to collect 4 of the 7 tokens wins.
85469.name: Balneator

85470.name: Zed Run!: The Survival Horror Game Show
85470.description:
Survival horror game show set 25 years after the zed virus turned 90% of the worlds populaion into flesh eating zombies.

Players must explore a 7 x 7 grid of tiles laid out to create the play area, the Dead City. During this exploration, gathering items, weapons, and prizes is key, as your contestant is initially tossed unarmed into the fray. In combat, rolling a 6 on a D6 will score you a kill, and found weapons and items will better that chance. Hazard tiles will make the run a bit more "hazardous" -- such as adding scores of hungry dead, which you can plop down on your favorite rivals, or "Infection" which will change your recently deceased contestant, into a ZED, now bent on devouring your former rivals and able to control the actions for your lesser zombie brothers.

In Zed Run! you grab the loot, find the exit and win big... the rest is zombie chow!

Components
1 Start tile
48 ZR tiles
32 Zombie Tokens
15 Item Cards
10 Prize Cards
2 dice (six-sided)
4 Character / Zed Cards
4 Character Tokens

85471.name: RPG Review (Issue 1 - Sep 2008)

rpgissuearticle.18451: All About The Tcho Tcho: Call of Cthulhu

85471.description:
From the Cover:

D&D 4th edition ... AD&D/D&D 3.5 Scenario... RuneQuest Demiurgy ... Call of Cthulhu Tcho Tcho ... Cannibal Contagion ... Mythweaver ... DragonQuest Retrospective ... The Dark Knight Review ... Fatal Frame/Project Zero IV ... Virtues of Bad Game Design ... Lord Orcus Listens! ... Hot Gossip Industry News


The cover art is "Arachne" by Gustave Doré.

85472.name: The Art of Science
85472.description:
The game was first released in Sweden in august 2010, but in may 2011 an updated version with 2000 questions was released in the UK.

Art of Science[sic] is a challenging trivia game for people interested in technology and natural science.

The categories are: Mathematics, Physics, Chemistry, Biology, Technology and "Other science" (a category of miscellaneous questions).

Whether you are a biologist or a mathematician, you will meet on equal terms - you chose your categories!
Lack of knowledge or temporary memory loss - ask a fellow player and share the points.

During the game you can also challenge your opponent to a duel, get chances of points-replication and answer questions like a universal genius. Take the chance to refresh your old knowledge and conquer new.

"Stimulating and challenging, ingenious and at times infuriating, this is smartly designed so that it’s fun and even a little strategic while stretching your scientific knowledge", Quentin Cooper

85473.name: The Unspeakable Oath (Issue 18 - Dec 2010)
85473.description:
subtitled A Digest of Arcane Lore for Cthulhu Mythos Roleplaying Games

Cover by Todd Shearer

After a long hiatus, The Unspeakable Oath returns with an 80-page issue released in December 2010.

Dedicated to Keith "Doc" Herber, bassist and world-class Call of Cthulhu writer, 1949-2009.

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

85474.description:
From the publishers website:

Welcome to the city of Verona, which inspired William Shakespeare to write "Romeo and Juliet" his most famous story. This inspired Petr Chval to create an exciting board game of intrigue. Experience the Italian Renaissance as Verona has become a very influential center of culture and business; also rampant with corruption and intrigue! The city is so rich and powerful that it has freed itself from the strict authority of the holy Roman Empire. Influential families now rule Verona replacing the weak puppet and figurehead, Prince Escalus! Who will gain supreme power? Experience the trials and tribulations of Verona and see the great battle unfold before your eyes and ears!

Game for 2-5 players and lasts about 60 mins. Players compete in hot auctions, plan intrigues and guess those (intrigues) of others by completing secret or public tasks. Winner needs sufficient economic and military power as well as domination of territory.

The Czech Board Game Project helps successfully place Czech game developers into the game board market. The board game Verona is the winner of the CBG contest for 2010.
85474.name: Verona

85475.name: Ti Rakau
85475.description:
This Maori Stick Game is called 'Ti Rakau' in Maori.

This game is played with two people or, at a more advanced level, four people. Each player needs one pair of wooden sticks. Players kneel on the floor across from each other and hold their sticks straight up, ends touching the floor. In unison, they perform a series of movements with their sticks, tapping their sticks together or against their partner's, progressing to throwing a stick to their partner and catching the one being thrown to them.

The aim is to keep going for as long as possible without dropping your sticks.

The last person who hasn't dropped a stick is the winner!

85476.name: ShuffleBowl
85476.description:
Players alternate turns rolling pucks, bouncing them off two rubber bands and trying to land in a scoring area similar to curling or shuffleboard. The object of the game is to score exactly 21 points. (User summary from rule sheet)

The board is similar to the one used in Rebound but has two shooting lanes with players at opposite ends of the board.

85477.name: Dead Space 2

videogamefranchise.6404: Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)

videogamehonor.31895: 2010 Game Critics Best Action/Adventure Game of the Year Nominee

85477.description:
This is a sequel to Dead Space.

From the official site:

- A horrific infestation is decimating a massive space city.
- Isaac Clarke must dismember, impale, and stomp his way across the Sprawl.
- Familiar as well as all-new grotesque creatures lurk around every corner.
- Wield a set of devastating tools to bring the terror to space. Impale with the Javelin, and turn limbs into deadly weapons with improved telekinesis, plus much more.
- Fire up Isaac's suit boosters to rocket around in zero gravity like never before with full 360° movement.
- For the first time, experience the horror of a Necromorph outbreak with others in online Multiplayer.

85478.description:
Bella and Bello are completely over the moon! Their friend Isabella has come to visit unexpectedly. And of course they want to give her their best bones. But where on earth have they buried them? Oh yes, under the garden gnome and there, beside the watering can.
Bella and Bello run about tirelessly, burrowing here and digging there...
The one who guides them over the lawn skilfully and is first to dig up the bone for Isabella together with them wins the game.

This game is played with two "dogs", wooden balls with ears attached to them, which are placed in a box which has several holes in the bottom. Each hole is marked by an item: watering can, a garden gnome, etc.

In the standard version of the game, a pile of cards each displaying two items is placed in the middle of the table. The active player takes the box and tries to roll the two dogs in the holes with marked with the items on the top card. If he succeeds, he gets to keep the card. In the meantime, his neighbour is repeatedly rolling a die which has a dog on one side. If he rolls the dog, then the active player's turn is over. The first player to gather three cards wins the game.

In the no-dice version all cards are arranged next to each other on the board. On each card, a burrowing chip is placed, face down. Some of these chips show a bone, others do not. When it is a player's turn, the tries to move the dogs into two holes, and then gets to inspect the burrowing chip on the card corresponding to the holes that the dogs have gone in. If the chip shows a bone, he gets to keep it, otherwise it is returned to the card. When there are only eight chips left on the card, the game ends, and the player with the most bones wins the game.
85478.name: Kugelhund

85479.name: Conheça o Brasil Estado a Estado
85479.description:
Card game about brazilian states and its capitals.

The goal of the game is to get more state cards than the other players.

There are three types of cards: brazilian maps, brazilian states and clues. Each player receive three state cards. One clue card is showed and the first player to call a state that corresponds to the clue, wins the state card. The game finishes when all clue cards are turned.

85481.name: First Samurai
85481.description:
User Summary

You control a samurai who wants take vengance for his master's death by a great demon. You should destroy various monsters and bosses finding them in the only one map, reaching each zone and collecting items.

85482.name: Four-Color to Fantasy (Revised)
85482.description:
From publisher blurb:

The d20 supplement that allows you to play superheroes in your favourite d20 game - modern or fantasy. Now revised with more super powers, more options, more POWER.

Rules for more superpowers than ever before, new prestige classes and templates and the most flexible way to create any type of superhero - this book is a toolkit to help you run the superhero game you want to run, in the system you like, and the setting you love.

Four-Color to Fantasy Revised contains different options for character advancement - from the traditonal fantasy-style rise from 1st-20th level to the more comic-book style approaches where powers change little but skill increases over time. Whether you want to play a low-powered vampire slayer or a veritable god, this book is designed to let you choose the genre and power level of your choice.

This superhero supplement for the d20 Fantasy and Modern rules sets concentrates on flexibility and modularity. Instead of giving you a new game, we have shown you how to turn your favorite d20 game into a superpowered campaign! A variety of are presented in order to do this - you can use the Hero class alongside regular d20 or modern core classes, you can build and use templates or you can simply buy superpowers with experience points. The choice is yours! This isn't OUR superhero game - this is YOUR superhero game!

85483.name: Grappling For Advanced Students: How to Master Your Chi!
85483.description:
From publisher blurb:

So you've mastered the basics of grappling and unarmed combat in GRAPPLING FOR BEGINNERS: HOW TO STRIKE, HOLD & THROW!, and you want to learn how to advance your career as a pugilistic, spin-kicking unarmed combatant? You've come to the right place!

This book assumes that you have a copy of GRAPPLING FOR BEGINNERS. If you haven't, you'll need to buy it before you'll make any sense out of these pages, because space is tight - nothing is going to be repeated here. Don't say you weren't warned - it was written right here on the product page when you bought this book!

So what will you find in these pages? First off, we're not going to complicate the rules. GRAPPLING FOR BEGINNERS was intended to make the grappling rules easy, and with this book we have no intention of changing that. So what you'll find here are new feats, prestige classes and so forth, all designed to make your character a better unarmed combatant but not to make your game's combat sequences more complicated.

15 new feats allow your unarmed fighter to specialize in his chosen way of fighting!
3 new prestige classes: the Pugilist, who relies on strikes; the Wrestler, who uses holds and throws; and the Martial-artist who combines the two and adds a dash of spiritualism!

85484.name: Grappling For Beginners: How to Strike, Hold & Throw!
85484.description:
From publisher blurb:

"How do the grapple rules work, again?"

The core grappling rules are somewhat unwieldy. These amended rules aim to make grappling in your game a little more fun! Grappling also includes unarmed strikes - kicks, punches, bites and so on.

This short, 7-page supplement is not intended to provide a complete martial arts system with fancy moves; it is intended to replace the grappling rules in the core books with something a little more elegant. The d20 combat system is abstract in nature: you don't worry about hit locations or the exact specifics of an attack, and these rules adhere to that philosophy.

Unarmed combat is divided into three basic moves: strike, hold and throw. The grappling rules are rewritten, some feats are changed and a couple more added to present a streamlined, easy to understand system which allows your characters to engage in unarmed combat without having to ask "How does grappling work again?"

In fact, your character can easily throw his opponent to the ground, hold him there and use his own dagger against him! It's easy to combine the three moves to represent almost any unarmed martial art style attacks without going into too much detail which slows down play.

85485.name: Sidhe Kin
85485.description:
From publisher blurb:

Crafted from the finest d20 components, the Librum Equitis line is the premiere line of d20 prestige class products. Librum Equitis volume IV brings you a full set of 14 prestige classes specifically for elves and their kin. Each prestige class is crafted to suite the elven temperament, society, and pursuits.

Within this book you will find:

The Arms Captain - a proven leader of the elven military
Councillor of the Trees - elders and advisors to the elven community
Keeper of Mysteries - guardians of elven lore and magics
Elven Knight - elite defenders of elven kind, bedecked in shining elven plate
Master Archer - precise and deadly master of the elven longbow
Elven Seeker - scouts and spies, sent into the world to keep their kin informed
Elven Sentinel - watchers and defenders of the secluded elven cities
Sea Captain - for not all elves hide their homes in wooded cities
Elven Smith - master of the crafts and skilled maker of magic items
Elven Treesinger - elves who remember how to speak to the natural world around them
Elven Windrider - elite pegasus-mounted knights
Spell Captain - elite military spellcasters & arcanists
Unicorn Rider - chaste elves of pure heart never touched by men and their mounts
Wood Elf Skinwalker - wood elven priests trained to take the forms and abilities of animals

85486.name: Mechamancy: The Clockwork Magic
85486.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mechamancy turns magic from its ancient role as a mysterious power into a modern tool. Mechamancers - mages who combine spellcasting with the principles of clockwork technology - are bringing magic to the common man, creating conveniences that will march the world toward a future where magic and science are one. Though they have many opponents who want to defend the old ways, the mechamancers have powerful weapons at their disposal, and the fantastic revolution seems inevitable.

Inside you will find the history of mechamancy, and the tools that will help you shape its future. Included are:

The Machinist and Technician prestige classes, those who command and create items of mechamancy.
15 mechamancy spells, including grand calculation and summon machine.
25 mechamancy items, including Skinner armor and the White-Barker Enhanced Light Cannon.
Detailed rules for designing and creating your own tools, weapons, armor, vehicles, and creatures with mechamancy.

85487.name: Mechamancy II: Living Machines
85487.description:
From publisher blurb:

The line between life and machine begins to blur.

Mechamancy II: Living Machines, the 33-page sequel to E.N. Publishing's Mechamancy: The Clockwork Magic, presents new clockwork magical prosthetics to let living heroes and villains gain the strengths of machines, and details a new variety of intelligent living constructs, the karakuri, which range from useful clockwork familiars and entertaining dancing golems, to the destructive Locusts of Worlds and the axiomatic outsiders known as mâchina.

You can use Living Machines as a stand-alone resource for new creatures and devices, but the devices presented herein use the clockwork craftsmanship rules in Mechamancy: The Clockwork magic. Like a function disk inserted into your cranium brain assembly, Living Machines gives you the knowledge you need if you are interested in creating your own clockwork creatures, or if you want to find new ways to strip away your own humanity to be replaced with cold mechanical power.

85488.name: Necromancer's Legacy: Bloodlines & Paragons
85488.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Compleat Librum ov Gar-Udok's Necromantic Artes is the necromantic masterpiece of M. Jason Parent, co-owner of E.N. Publishing. Originally released in PDF in February of 2002, this dark tome was nominated for the Best Rules Supplement ENnie and received honourable mention for another.

But the legacy of the dark necromancer has not truly been uncovered yet. Even now, the core material of the Necromancer's Legacy is being revised and updated to the current edition rules, and new secrets are being unearthed and added. Whispers of fell arcanists casting magics using the entrails of fallen foes now circulate around the campfires. Tales are told of giant forges brought back from the island nations and used to forge the very souls of enemies and innocents into horrific magical devices. And even now, the blood of the undead seems to flow within the veins of northlanders, with many exhibiting strange affinities and links to fell beasts such as ghouls and vampires.

Necromancer's Legacy - Bloodlines & Paragons explores five of the classic undead introducing a paragon class for each as well as Minor, Intermediate and Major bloodlines for each.

The races covered in this product are: Ghosts, Ghouls, Liches, Mummies and Vampires. Each has a fully detailed paragon class and all three levels of bloodline.

85489.name: Necromancer's Legacy 2: The Dark Art of Visceromancy
85489.description:
From publisher blurb:

Vile Kurosh held the massive and bloodied bone over his head for a moment, muttering dark invocations to even darker deities, and then began to grow. As his form lurched and shifted into something much larger, the bone snapped, showering his golden hair with viscera and marrow. As the bones fell away from his hands, he looked down upon the field of battle, a being twice his normal height.

Visceromancy has been called the magic of the flesh. This little known art is not for the squeamish or faint of heart. Those who practice it must be skilled with their hands as well as their minds. Visceromancy allows an individual to mend torn flesh, reattach lost limbs, and to tap into the latent power of a creature's organs.

Most visceromancers are outcasts living on the fringe of society practicing their art in secret. They are commonly known as butchers and their art outlawed in most kingdoms.

Many such spellcasters have discovered the need to keep thieves and similar lowlifes on their payroll. They need these degenerates to help them with the local law enforcement as well as to help acquire fresh bodies.

Explore this dark art in this 6-page mini-PDF expansion to the classic award-nominated book of necromantic magics. This booklet explores two aspects of the art of visceromancy - the art of using the organs of one's foes to manifest unusual magical abilities or to enhance existing spells.

85490.name: Powers that be: Councilor Remorga
85490.description:
From publisher blurb:
